title: Manager Web and Azure Operations
description:
At Sandvik Coromant in Sandviken we’re currently looking for a dedicated Manager for our Web and Azure Operations team. An exciting opportunity to be part of a forward-thinking and competent team at the forefront of technology.
Joining us, you’ll have the chance to make significant contributions to our operations and work in a supportive and dynamic environment with many opportunities for professional growth. We’re eager to meet you!
Your mission
In this position, you manage our IT environment – the daily operations of our web platforms and our cloud operations – while ensuring compliance with IT security standards. The availability of our web platform is critical to our business operations, and you make sure that it runs smoothly.
You take responsibility for a small team where you develop people, manage the budget and ensure effective vendor relationships. To drive continuous improvement, you collaborate closely with other departments and stakeholders. Your job requires a strong sense of urgency and professionalism – and you always aim to deliver high quality work in a timely manner.
Your profile
We’re looking for someone with experience in IT operations, project management or as a system or product owner. You have a proven track record of managing budgets. We support our entire global business, and we see it as beneficial if you have previously acted in a similar environment. Your knowledge is backed by a post-secondary education or equivalent work experience. Proficiency in English is a must and knowledge of Swedish is highly advantageous.
Your eagerness to learn and improve combined with an interest in IT and technology, and a willingness to develop, both yourself and others, is perfect for this role. You’re comfortable in balancing innovation and risk management. With strong team building and collaboration skills, you quickly build stable relationships with people you encounter – making sure to share best practices and take our work to the next level!
Our culture
Innovation is in our DNA and we’re proud to shape the future of manufacturing in close collaboration with our customers and partners. We believe in an inclusive, equal and open-minded culture, and we nurture our diversities to form a solid foundation for achieving great results. Add fair and rewarding benefits, as well as many different career opportunities in an inspiring global environment. Meet some of your future colleagues at our career page or visit our website, LinkedIn or Facebook page to get to know us further.
Contact information
Are you curious to know more about this position? Please contact Max Wikman, recruiting manager, at +46 (0)76-118 77 29.
We have already decided on which advertising channels and marketing campaigns we wish to use and respectfully decline any additional contacts in that matter.
Union contacts:* Thomas Lilja, Unionen, +46 (0)70-261 04 82
* Göran Norell, Akademikerföreningen, +46 (0)70-616 43 78
* Peter Olsson-Andrée, Ledarna, +46 (0)70-222 48 55


Recruitment Specialist: Anna Pettersen
How to apply
Send your application no later than December 8th, 2024. Click apply and include your resume and cover letter in English. Please note that we don’t accept applications by e-mail. Job ID: R0072937.
As we aim for a fair recruitment process, we utilize assessment tools to safeguard objectivity. When you apply for this job, you will therefore receive an invitation via email to a personality and logic ability test. Feedback comes immediately after the test has been completed and the selection process begins after the application deadline.
To learn more about our recruitment process, please visit our career site or contact HR Services at hrservices.sweden@sandvik.com.

title: SMB Sales Executive
description:
**About Us****nShift** is the leading global provider of cloud delivery management solutions (SaaS), we enable the frictionless shipment and return of almost one billion shipments across 190 countries each year. We are headquartered in London and Oslo and have over 500 employees across offices in Sweden, Finland, Norway, Denmark, the United Kingdom, Poland, the Netherlands, Belgium, and Romania.
Our software is used by many of the world leading e-commerce, retail, manufacturing, and 3PL shippers due to us having over 1000 carriers integrated into our platform, nearly 3 times more than our competitors!  

If you buy goods online, there is a strong chance that nShift has powered that delivery, so come and join us as we shape the future of shipping, one frictionless journey at a time.
Purpose of Role
Exciting and career-advancing opportunity for a customer-centric and solution-focused sales professional with strong presentation, negotiation and closing skills to join an expanding international organisation with 25+ years of experience and a market leading position.
We’re passionate about increasing our customers revenue and making shipping easy through creating a community of connected customers and partners on a single platform and are looking for great enterprise sales professionals to help us fulfil our vision and mission.  

Overall responsibility
We’re looking for a SMB Sales Executive to join our Swedish SMB team. Our ideal candidate thrives when being challenged and is enthusiastic about working in a fast-paced environment. If you are eager to work with smart people to solve complex problems, then we are looking forward to hearing from you!
Our Sales Representative’s focus solely on creating new revenue by selling to new customers and extending the usage of nShift products to our current customer base.
You will be joining nShift at a pivotal period, the business is going through an exciting transformation after the merger of five leading companies within the industry, creating a true market leader in our space.**About you**
To be successful in this role, you should have previous experience in a software solutions based sales role. You will use your communication skills to cultivate strong relationships with customers, from identified opportunity until you hand over to the account executives. If you are motivated and results-driven, and enjoy working in a team environment, we’d like to meet you.
The area of responsibility includes:Present our solution to potential clients
Identify client needs and suggest appropriate products/services from the nShift portfolio
Build long-term trusting relationships with prospects
Report to the Director of Sales on (weekly/monthly/quarterly) results & improvement ideas
Stay up-to-date with new products/  

services and market trends
**Competence and experience**
Requirements:Proven commercial and business acumen, skills to develop business through outbound and inbound opportunities.
Experience in presenting to, negotiating with and closing at C-level.
Strong relationship management and networking abilities on different organizational levels.
Ability to accurately forecast revenue based on current business opportunities
Energetic & proactive approach.
Ability to be independent and work collective within a team
University degree educated or any Sales Qualifications will be an advantage
Experience in selling SaaS solutions to the e-com/retail sector is an advantage.
Flexible mindset and can-do attitude: Willingness to adapt to customer and organizational needs.
Track record of achieving quotas & KPIs
Experience with CRM software
  

(e.g. Salesforce)
Understanding of sales performance metrics
Excellent communication and negotiation skills
Ability to deliver engaging presentations
Must be fluent in English and Swedish written, reading and spoken.
Demonstrated high activity levels of outreach and prospecting.
  

At nShift we believe in embracing diversity in all forms and fostering an inclusive environment for everyone which we believe is essential for our continued success. We're an equal-opportunity employer which means that all applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to ethnicity, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, family or parental status, national origin, veteran, neurodiversity, or disability status.

title: Sales Support
description:
Vi ger samma löfte till våra kollegor som till kunder. Löftet är att alltid vara "beside you", "behind you" och "before you". Vi kallar det för "The Iver way". Nu söker vi en engagerad och driven person inom Sales Support! Är du en serviceinriktad person med ett öga för detaljer? Då har vi jobbet för dig!
  
  

**Om Iver:**  

Iver är en ledande nordisk helhetsleverantör av molnbaserade IT-tjänster med spetskompetens inom drift, cybersäkerhet, cloud och innovation. Våra tjänster är kritiska inte bara för våra kunder – utan för digitaliseringen av samhället i stort.
  
  

**Om tjänsten:**  

Som Sales Support blir du en nyckelspelare i vårt säljteam. Du kommer att arbeta nära våra säljare och kunder, med fokus på att skapa en smidig säljprocess och ge exceptionell service. Din roll är att hantera administrativa uppgifter, koordinera projekt och säkerställa att allt fungerar effektivt.
  
  

**Exempel på arbetsuppgifter:**  

Hantering av tidrader på kunder utan Governance, samt stöd till Operations management och KAM för större kunder med governance
  
Kravhantering inkassokrav
  
Licenshantering, säkra korrekt debitering av CSP
  
Hantera vidarefakturering underleverantörer, support till våra försäljningsvertikaler
  
Lägga upp och hantera kredit samt tilläggsfaktureringsärenden
  
Följa upp leveranser av beställd hårdvara direkt mot slutkund (direktförsäljning)
  
Stötta i kundevent samt merförsäljnings- och kundvårdsaktiviteter
  
Avtalsadministration och kunddokumentation
  
Regelbundet gå igenom öppna ordrar och föra dialogen med KAM om vad som ska göras med dem och sedan utföra detta
  
Ha koll på vilka kunder som har öppna fordringar och ha en dialog med kundreskontra och KAM om hur dessa ska hanteras
  
  

Vad erbjuder vi dig på Iver?
  
Hos Iver får du möjlighet att arbeta med den senaste tekniken och vara med på en spännande tillväxtresa. Iver är ett bolag med entreprenöriella rötter och en kultur som präglas av flexibilitet och samarbete. Vårt mål är att våra kunder – här i Norden och internationellt – ska se oss som en ledande partner för digital transformation. På Iver är vi inkluderande och strävar efter genuint samarbete där vi arbetar mot gemensamma mål. Inom Iver finns stora möjligheter till utveckling och vi står bakom dig när du vill lära dig mer – inom ditt specialområde, ledarskap eller nya områden. Hos Iver är du också en del av ett ambitiöst och innovativt företag, vilket innebär att förbättra, testa, utvärdera och våga ändra hur vi gör saker är viktiga ingredienser och vi är övertygade om att det är så vi utvecklas.
  
  

**Vem söker vi:**  

För att lyckas i rollen som Sales Support hos oss tror vi att du har tidigare erfarenhet av att arbeta med administration och stöd inom en försäljningsorganisation, med fördel inom IT branschen eller liknande där fokus är B2B, tjänsteförsäljning och/eller licenshantering. Vi tror också att du har
  
  

**Vidare tror vi att du:**  

Högskoleutbildning inom ekonomi, business administration eller liknande med erfarenhet av att hantera faktuering, kravhantering och kredit.
  
Erfarenhet av administration och uppföljning i CRM och ERP system.
  
Är strukturerad och har förmåga att hantera flera parallella uppgifter.
  
Är noggrann med ett öga för detaljer och ser ständiga förbättringsmöjligheter.
  
Har goda kunskaper i Microsoft Office-paketet, särskilt Excel.
  
Behärskar svenska och engelska flytande i tal och skrift.
  
Är en lagspelare med en positiv inställning och ett stort engagemang.
  
  

**Meriterande krav:**  

Erfarenhet av leverantörsfakturor inom IT-drift och förmåga att avgöra vad som ingår/ingår inte i tjänst.
  
Erfarenhet av licenshantering CSP lösningar.
  
  

**Placeringsort:**  

Iver finns på 25 platser I Sverige & Norge, för denna tjänst ser vi att utgår från vårt kontor I Solna eller Västerås.
  
  

Sök till oss!
  
Urval sker löpande, tjänsten kan tillsättas före sista ansökningsdag. Iver eftersträvar en jämn könsfördelning och värdesätter etnisk och kulturell mångfald. Önskad start är snarast eller enligt överenskommelse. Sista ansökningsdag 2024-12-13. Du är välkommen att kontakta Carl-Martin Rydenlund (carl-martin.rydenlund@iver.se) vid frågor eller funderingar kring tjänsten. Vi ser fram emot din ansökan.

title: CIS Sales, Nordics - AVP
description:
**Some Key attributes :**  

* Ability to rollup the sleeves to work with Customer, Partners and internal teams to bring the customer vision to a winning solution
* Collaborate with customers in understanding business objective, work with various teams in orchestrating objective into solution response.
* Ensure alignment of systems with business objectives, lead strategic decision-making for IT transformation initiatives.
* Ability to design & architect IT solutions alongside customer teams
* Conduct requirement gathering analysis and workshops, develop pre-sales solutions and perform technical assessments.
* Provide technical leadership along with strong negotiation skills in multi-party environment.
* Monitor and manage timelines, deliverables and stakeholder communication.


**Essential:**  

* Must have 15+ years of experience working in Tier-1 GSI’s
* Have experience & expertise in Cloud, Infrastructure, End User Computing, Cyber Security transformations, migrations and business transformation programs.
* Experience working with global teams and ability to drive the required customer outcome


**Role and responsibilities:**  

The individual will play a pivotal role in driving the success of our Cloud Infrastructure Services portfolio across the target customer base. Being a hybrid role of hunting and farming, this role requires a blend of technical expertise and strong sales acumen to help customers understand, implement, and optimize their cloud infrastructure solutions. The individual will work closely with the industry sales team, solution architects (onshore and offshore), and customers to identify their specific infrastructure needs and deliver tailored solutions. Individual will be responsible to ensure that customers receive the right cloud infrastructure services that meet their technical and business requirements.
  
Lead and manage business development strategy in the geography for CIS.
  
Drive focus on revenue growth, account retention and customer satisfaction.
  
Develop, manage, and leverage relationships in existing clients and accounts.
  
Drive and manage delivery led growth across the portfolio.
  
Develop partnerships and necessary ecosystem to grow the portfolio
  
Ability to rollup the sleeves to work with Customer, Partners and internal teams to bring the customer vision to a winning solution
  
Collaborate with customers in understanding business objective, work with various teams in orchestrating objective into solution response.
  
Ensure alignment of systems with business objectives, lead strategic decision-making for IT transformation initiatives.
  
Ability to design & architect IT solutions alongside customer teams
  
Conduct requirement gathering analysis and workshops, develop pre-sales solutions and perform technical assessments.
  
Provide technical leadership along with strong negotiation skills in multi-party environment.
  
Monitor and manage timelines, deliverables and stakeholder communication.
  
  

Sales Ability/Competencies/Knowledge
  
Proven track record of consistently growing revenues YoY.
  
Key connects in designated accounts.
  
Played a similar role in a similar or larger IT Services firm.
  
Understanding the broader business context in which clients operate.
  
  

Key KRAs
  
Revenue growth in assigned portfolio each fiscal year.
  
Total contract value booking in assigned portfolio each fiscal year.
  
Maintaining profitability target in the assigned portfolio.
  
New logo acquisitions in growth portfolio each fiscal year.
  
Contribute to three (3) thought leadership publications / speaker sessions each fiscal year.
  
  

Domain/Industry Expertise (Must have industry experience)
  
Priority for candidates who understand the following industries: M&E, RCG, HLS.
  
Open to candidates from other industries as long as they demonstrate deep understanding of Cloud and Infrastructure Services.
  
  

Technology Understanding/ Appreciation
  
Cloud (IaaS and PaaS) – Strategy, Migration and Operations
  
Private and Hybrid cloud setup and operations
  
End User Services including Digital workplace and Service Desk
  
Software Defined Infra Operations
  
  

Other specific attributes
  
Have a Point of View (POV) on the future for each service area in CIS.
  
Ability to think through logically and build an approach to solve specific needs.
  
Positive energy through optimistic conversations
  
Demonstrate understanding of industry and impact of our services.
  
Financial acumen for various deal constructs.
  
  

Öppen för alla
  
Vi fokuserar på din kompetens, inte dina övriga förutsättningar. Vi är öppna för att anpassa rollen eller arbetsplatsen efter dina behov.

title: Analytics Engineer
description:
Ready for a new adventure building the next-generation retail experience?
  
As an Analytics Engineer at Bambuser, you’ll be an integral part of our data team. You will focus on building scalable analytics workflows, maintaining and developing key dashboards, and solving complex analytical problems in a scalable manner. You’ll take part in driving our analytics strategy, ensuring data quality and availability across the business. In this role, you will have a visible impact by creating data products that directly influence the business, customers, and product insights.
  
  

**Key Responsibilities:**  

Build and maintain analytics tables to ensure data is easily accessible and actionable.
  
  

Develop and maintain key dashboards in ThoughtSpot and other BI tools to serve key business insights to internal teams.
  
  

Collaborate closely with cross-functional teams, including Data Engineering, Product, and Customer Success Management (CSM), to deliver actionable insights.
  
  

Solve complex analytical challenges and provide scalable, high-quality data solutions (ie: attribution modeling).
  
  

Contribute to the development of Bambuser's data strategy, including the improvement of our "golden data sets" and other key initiatives.
  
  

Drive improvements in data quality and availability, helping the company make data-driven decisions.
  
  

Build and optimize data products exposed to our customers, impacting their experience and success.
  
  

Technical Skills & Requirements
  
Proficient in SQL and familiar with transformation tools such as Dataform or dbt.
  
  

Experience with Python, or similar, and an understanding of cloud platforms, particularly GCP (Google Cloud Platform), is a plus.
  
  

Familiarity with event-driven architectures.
  
  

Experience with BI tools (e.g., ThoughtSpot, Looker) and a desire to create meaningful, visually appealing insights.
  
  

Business and Soft Skills
  
**High stakeholder engagement:** You will regularly interface with both technical and non-technical teams across the business.
  
  

Familiarity with e-commerce or streaming data in an event-driven architecture is a plus.
  
  

Strong communication skills with an ability to explain technical solutions to non-technical audiences.
  
  

Experience
  
Mid-level to senior experience, with a proven track record in analytics engineering, data warehousing, or a similar role.
  
  

Experience with GCP (BigQuery, Dataflow) is preferred but not required.
  
  

Opportunities for Growth
  
Gain exposure to the entire data architecture at Bambuser, with opportunities to contribute across the stack.
  
  

Play a key role in developing Bambuser's future data products and strategy.
  
  

Collaborate closely with the Head of Data and product teams to build cutting-edge data solutions.
  
  

Opportunities to take on leadership in data initiatives and scale insights across the company.
  
  

This is Bambuser
  
Bambuser’s Video Commerce technology drives customer engagement and sales for some of the world’s largest brands and retailers. At the forefront of live streaming technology since 2007, Bambuser launched interactive eCommerce solutions in 2019 and quickly became the platform of choice for companies worldwide. Our team has established long-term partnerships and supported campaign activations for brands and retailers including Adidas, Hugo Boss, brands within the LVMH group, Clarins, Selfridges, Sonos, and many others.
  
Bambuser values diversity and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer, welcoming individuals from all backgrounds, regardless of where you come from or what you believe.

title: Customer Executive - Tietoevry Care (m/f/d)
description:
You may apply to Tietoevry by selecting Apply and fill your application details to the form. You may also Apply by using LinkedIn and populate details to your application from your LinkedIn profile.
The Health Care sector is undergoing a profound digital transformation that includes investments across the entire care system to unleash the potential of data driven decisions, connecting all stakeholders, from citizens and patients to specialist care providers.
There is an immense need for enhanced digital capabilities in the Health & Care sector – and software businesses like Tietoevry Care have an enormous opportunity to contribute to improved health and care, while at the same time, nurturing substantial business growth.
Globally the market for digital solutions for Health & Care is one of most vibrant in terms of new solutions and expectations on positive effects on the Heath & Care business, as well as in terms of growth numbers.
Tietoevry Care Sweden - country/market organization
Tietoevry Care Sweden is the country/market organization working closely and long-term with our customers and partners to drive product innovation and value creation. We are responsible for customers, market development and sales - Besides our market and customer focus we are working closely with our colleagues in the product units to with our market and customer understanding as a base contribute to our strategy and product roadmaps.
About the role as Customer Executive
You will have a key role in the Care Sweden team, developing customer accounts as well as our market presence. Your vital role, close to our most important customers, will provide you with understanding about the customers’ digitalization strategy and journey ahead. In your role you are a key person taking part in developing our strategy for the market and to influence our short- and long-term product strategies.
Among your focus responsibilities and activities are, to* Drive growth in our market and at your customers - one focus region is Västra Götalandsregionen
* Create excellent customer relationships
* Ensure the right guidance for the customer in their digitalization and be seen as a trusted advisor and partner
* Understand and identify customers’ present and future needs
* Create new opportunities, and generate new business
* Take an active role internally to drive and develop our products and offerings to suit the current and future market needs


Ideally you possess the following competences and abilities:* Experience from large and complex value driven sales and deliveries in software, IT systems and projects
* Clearly takes the role as strategic advisor and peer to c-level, and below
* Strong presenter and creator of complex value propositions orally and in written
* Fluent in spoken and written Swedish, and you speak proficient business English


It would be great if you also had experience from one or more of below areas:* Business development or strategic IT position at large healthcare provider or at municipality within the Social Care area
* Complex business sales from supplier of complex digital solutions and software to Health and/or Social Care
* Senior management consulting experience for healthcare market
* …..or, the above within relevant firms and to relevant customers providing a good base for our business


What's in it for you?
With us you will be part of the important and meaningful work of developing healthcare for all of us. You have an important mission to make a difference that really matters. In addition, as a company we offer you professional growth, open and friendly culture, and an outstanding work-life balance! We believe that our organizational culture is an important part of enabling you to be successful.
We provide a flexible hybrid work model as part of our culture and way of working. Finally, we also believe in curiosity and learning as a lifestyle. We want to encourage you to keep up that curiosity and deepen your knowledge on topics you’re interested in. For example, we host a ‘Keep Learning Week’ once a year, a week where everyone at Tietoevry has the possibility to join different training courses in a truly global setting.
Could you be our new colleague?
We look forward to hearing from you! We will fill the position as soon as we find the right person, so we encourage you to apply today. If you have any questions regarding this role, please contact the hiring manager Head of Tietoevry Care Sweden Anders Jönebratt @ anders.jonebratt@tietoevry.com*We perform a security clearance on all final candidates.**Tietoevry* *declines calls from recruitment companies.*  

About Tietoevry
Tietoevry creates purposeful technology that reinvents the world for good. We are a leading technology company with a strong Nordic heritage and global capabilities. Based on our core values of openness, trust and diversity, we work with our customers to develop digital futures where businesses, societies, and humanity thrive.
Our 24,000 experts globally specialize in cloud, data, and software, serving thousands of enterprise and public-sector customers in more than 90 countries. Tietoevry’s annual turnover is approximately EUR 3 billion and the company’s shares are listed on the NASDAQ exchange in Helsinki and Stockholm, as well as on Oslo Børs.
#LI-Hybrid
#LI-AS5
At Tietoevry, we believe in the power of diversity, equity, and inclusion. We encourage applicants of all backgrounds, genders (m/f/d), and walks of life to join our team, as we believe that this fosters an inspiring workplace and fuels innovation. Our commitment to openness, trust, and diversity is at the heart of our mission to create digital futures that benefit businesses, societies, and humanity. Diversity, equity and inclusion (tietoevry.com)

title: Graduate or Junior Business Analyst for Accenture Song
description:
Are you a recent graduate or about to graduate from university? Do you see a future career in consulting? Bring your talent and passion to Accenture and help us deliver on the promise of technology and human ingenuity! Take this opportunity to develop your skills and build an extraordinary career.


Our **Song Commerce team** is a global leader in transforming digital commerce, empowering businesses to craft engaging, flexible, and data-driven purchasing experiences that drive growth. By leveraging advanced AI and cloud technologies, we enable our clients to adapt to fast-evolving markets, scale omnichannel strategies, and optimize customer journeys across platforms. Join our team to be at the forefront of innovative commerce solutions, helping shape the future of online retail and digital engagement.

**The Roles:**  

We are looking for business analysts for **two different teams** within Song Commerce:

 **Advisory:**

* This team focuses on customer experience strategy for commerce, helping our clients design and optimize customer journeys that enhance engagement and drive business results. You'll work closely with stakeholders to understand their needs, conduct research, and craft data-driven strategies for improving the digital customer experience.

 **Customer Tech:**

* This team is more tech-oriented, where you'll work as a business analyst with a focus on technical solutions and digital transformation. You'll bridge the gap between business and technology, capturing requirements and collaborating with developers to implement cutting-edge commerce technologies. Additionally, you will quickly gain great insights into other interesting roles such as Scrum Master or Product Owner. You can also transition into a more technical role (developer or architect) if you have the skills and the ambitions to develop your career in this direction.

 **What more you will do as a Business Analyst:**  

In both teams, you’ll work as part of a project team to build enduring, trust-based relationships with different stakeholders. You’ll get early responsibility and build your skills and expertise through interesting and challenging work. Among other things, you will:

* Understand and translate customer needs into business and technology solutions, providing consultation on the customer digital journey and digital transformation
* Own tasks such as conducting customer and market research, developing presentations, and preparing and running workshops
* Use ambiguity and uncertainty to your advantage to generate innovative outcomes while experimenting with new technologies and methods
* Collaborate with multinational, high-performing teams, learning from each other and supporting each other’s development
* Gain expertise in the latest trends in the commerce domain, becoming well-versed in market-relevant technologies, platforms, and industry players, guiding our clients toward the best-fit solutions

  

**Who we are looking for:**

* Soon to be graduated with a relevant master’s degree. E.g., it can be studies within Business, Computer Science, Technology, Design, Innovation, Engineering or other relevant areas
* Passion and drive to work with technologies in a project and team-oriented environment
* You have proven strong academic results
* You are an analytical problem-solver with strong business acumen and technical interest
* You are ambitious, driven, flexible, solution-oriented and eager to start your career
* You have excellent written and oral presentation skills

 **Office and start**


We are looking for graduates to join our offices in Stockholm in late summer/autumn 2025. We offer a hybrid workplace which means that you will work either in our client office, in one of our own offices or from your virtual "home office".

 **Application**


Send your application and attach:

* CV
* Cover Letter
* University transcripts/grades

  

Upload all files under "Upload Resume/CV". Please note that all these documents are required for a complete application. **Only complete applications are reviewed.**  

  

If your application proceeds to the next step, you will receive an invitation to two tests that aim to measure your analytical ability as well as a personality form.

 **What is in it for you:**

* Great development opportunities to start building your professional career and exploring other roles
* Extensive training to develop your business acumen, technical and professional skills including on-the-job learning and formal training
* Access to comprehensive tools and frameworks supported by our global organization - including methodology, knowledge databases, expert networks and benchmarks
* A dedicated mentor to guide you in your career at Accenture
* Inspiring colleagues to support you in your daily work
* Over time, you will also have leadership responsibilities and lead teams
* A work/life balance and will provide you the opportunity to do everything you want aside of work

 **What you also get**  

  

**Accenture IF**


Accenture IF is a community hosted by our colleagues – for our colleagues, to meet and practice sports and physical activities. We offer a wide range of activities like football, racket sports, running, sailing, golf, yoga and much more.


To exercise sports you enjoy in the company of others, will help you stay motivated and healthy. Join our yearly events such as a cross-country skiing bootcamp, Accenture European Championship in football or an upcoming hiking trip in the mountains. We strongly believe in work-life balance and to have fun together!  

  

**Parental leave**


We want our employees to grow and achieve value in life, both in their profession and in their personal life. Accenture offer a market leading compensation for parental leave – we pay for 270 days and compensate 80% of the difference between Social Insurance Agency’s (Försäkringskassan) maximum coverage and a base pay up to 80 000 SEK/month.  

  

**Sick leave/Well-being**


In need of medical treatment, we want our employees to get well supported. All Accenture employees are covered by a health insurance by Skandia - Skandia Lifeline Access. The insurance offers healthcare of physical and mental treatments, including rehabilitation. During sick leave you will get well covered, Accenture pay 80% of your salary day 2-14 and 90% day 15-90.  

  

Our **“Truly Human”** network aim to bring us all together – as truly human individuals. We commit to care for ourselves and others, to foster an open-minded and supporting environment. Together we can help each other to achieve our aspirations and become the best version of ourselves. One of many initiatives are “Truly Human Health Academy”, a 100-day journey filled with classes held by health- and dietician experts, workshops, and buddy challenges – to learn and reflect on well-being and daily habits.  

  

**Networks**


At Accenture we offer network opportunities, for our employees to meet and share common interests. Our aim is to foster a company culture that stands for inclusion and diversity – a place for everyone in terms of cross-cultural diversity, ethnicity, gender, disability, mental health, and LGBTQI.
company_description: Our 721,000 people deliver on the promise of technology and human ingenuity every day, serving clients in more than 120 countries. We embrace the power of change to create value and shared success.

title: Front Office Hotel Riverton AB
description:
Älskar du mötet med människor, att vara ansiktet utåt och leverera förstklassig service? Har du dessutom erfarenhet av att arbeta i front office? Nu söker vi dig som vill växa och utvecklas tillsammans med oss på Hotel Riverton AB. Läs mer om tjänsten och vem vi söker!

**Front office/receptionist**


I rollen som receptionist kommer du vara vårt ansikte utåt och vara den första (och sista) person som våra kunder möter. Därför kommer din roll framför allt innefatta servicefokus, där du kommer vara lyhörd för kundens önskemål och ge bästa förutsättningar att få en nöjd gäst. Du kommer ta hand om våra kunder över disk, men också via telefon och mejl. Du kommer hantera in- och utcheckningar, ta emot bokningar, hantera klagomål och informera våra kunder om vilka möjligheter som finns hos oss för en behaglig vistelse. Vi arbetar i Opera Cloud, som är den senaste och mer innovativa versionen av Opera PMS. Tjänsten motsvarar heltid och innefattar kvällar och helger enligt rullande schema.

**Vad erbjuder vi dig?**


Vi erbjuder dig en familjär arbetsplats med hjärta, där vi verkligen värdesätter vår personal och strävar efter att skapa en personlig, behaglig och engagerad atmosfär. För oss är det viktigt att varje människa känner sig fri att vara sig själv och skapa förutsättningar för kompetensutveckling här hos oss.


**Vem söker vi?**


Vi söker dig som brinner för att leverera förstklassig service och se till att våra gäster får en oförglömlig upplevelse. För att lyckas i rollen är det viktigt att du är trygg i dig själv, har glimten i ögat och trivs med många kontaktytor. Du är social och har lätt för att kommunicera med människor på både svenska och engelska. Du förstår vikten av att snabbt agera vid eventuella klagomål för att bevara en positiv bild hos kunden. Som person motiveras du av att göra det där lilla extra för att göra så att kunden känner sig väl omhändertagen och sedd. Du värdesätter ett bra samarbete med dina kollegor och tycker det är självklart att man tillsammans arbetar för att nå gemensamma mål.

**Hotel Riverton AB**


Hotel Riverton är ett familjeägt och drivet designhotell beläget vid vattnet i centrala Göteborg. Vi lägger stor vikt på vår personal, på dig som individ, dina kunskaper och egenskaper. Vår största konkurrensfördel är utan tvekan vår organisation med dess individuella personligheter, men också att vi värdesätter moderna arbetsverktyg. Under år 2019/2020 valde vi att göra en större investering för att utveckla ett starkt och attraktivt koncept för framtiden inom hotell, restaurang, konferens, gym och spa. I samband med renoveringen genomgick vi också en re-branding av företaget för att bygga ett starkare varumärke på framtiden. Nu behöver vi förstärka vår front office med en supervisor, för att komplettera vårt team.

**Krav**

* Erfarenhet som hotellreceptionist
* Flytande svenska och engelska i tal och skrift

Erfarenhet från bokningssystem  
* 

*Varmt välkommen med din ansökan! Observera att vi arbetar med löpande urval vilket innebär att tjänsten kan tillsättas före sista ansökningsdatum.*

 **Sista ansökningsdatum:** 2024-12-20  

  

**Tillträde:** Enligt överenskommelse  

  

**Tjänst:** Heltid  

  

**Ort:** Göteborg

title: Sales Executive
description:
**About Us**

**nShift** is the leading global provider of cloud delivery management solutions (SaaS), we enable the frictionless shipment and return of almost one billion shipments across 190 countries each year. We are headquartered in London and Oslo and have over 500 employees across offices in Sweden, Finland, Norway, Denmark, the United Kingdom, Poland, the Netherlands, Belgium, and Romania.


Our software is used by many of the world leading e-commerce, retail, manufacturing, and 3PL shippers due to us having over 1000 carriers integrated into our platform, nearly 3 times more than our competitors!

  

If you buy goods online, there is a strong chance that nShift has powered that delivery, so come and join us as we shape the future of shipping, one frictionless journey at a time.

##### **Purpose of Role**


Exciting and career-advancing opportunity for a customer-centric and solution-focused sales professional with strong presentation, negotiation and closing skills to join an expanding international organisation with 25+ years of experience and a market leading position.


We’re passionate about increasing our customers revenue and making shipping easy through creating a community of connected customers and partners on a single platform and are looking for great enterprise sales professionals to help us fulfil our vision and mission.

##### **Overall responsibility**


We’re looking for a Sales Executive to join our Swedish customer management team with main focus on upgrading our existing customer with our latest products. Our ideal candidate thrives when being challenged and is enthusiastic about working in a fast-paced environment. If you are eager to work with smart people to solve complex problems, then we are looking forward to hearing from you!


Our Sales Representative’s focus solely on creating new revenue by selling to new customers and extending the usage of nShift products to our current customer base.  

  



You will be joining nShift at a pivotal period, the business is going through an exciting transformation after the merger of five leading companies within the industry, creating a true market leader in our space.

##### **About you**


To be successful in this role, you should have previous experience in a software solutions based sales role. You will use your communication skills to cultivate strong relationships with customers, from identified opportunity until you hand over to the account executives. If you are motivated and results-driven, and enjoy working in a team environment, we’d like to meet you.

##### **The area of responsibility includes:**

* Present our solution to potential clients
* Identify client needs and suggest appropriate products/services from the nShift portfolio
* Build long-term trusting relationships with prospects
* Report to the Director of Sales on (weekly/monthly/quarterly) results & improvement ideas
* Stay up-to-date with new products/  

services and market trends

##### **Competence and experience**

##### **Requirements:**

* Proven commercial and business acumen, skills to develop business through outbound and inbound opportunities.
* Experience in presenting to, negotiating with and closing at C-level.
* Strong relationship management and networking abilities on different organizational levels.
* Ability to accurately forecast revenue based on current business opportunities
* Energetic & proactive approach.
* Ability to be independent and work collective within a team
* University degree educated or any Sales Qualifications will be an advantage
* Experience in selling SaaS solutions to the e-com/retail sector is an advantage.
* Flexible mindset and can-do attitude: Willingness to adapt to customer and organizational needs.
* Track record of achieving quotas & KPIs
* Experience with CRM software
  

(e.g. Salesforce)
* Understanding of sales performance metrics
* Excellent communication and negotiation skills
* Ability to deliver engaging presentations
* Must be fluent in English and Swedish written, reading and spoken.
* Demonstrated high activity levels of outreach and prospecting.


At nShift we believe in embracing diversity in all forms and fostering an inclusive environment for everyone which we believe is essential for our continued success. We're an equal-opportunity employer which means that all applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to ethnicity, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, family or parental status, national origin, veteran, neurodiversity, or disability status.


#LI-HS1


#LI-Hybrid

title: Customer Success Manager
description:
**Why join Bannerflow?**  

Our mission is to accelerate creativity and collaboration for marketing teams, at scale and across channels. To deliver on this, we have defined five must-win battles that will guide us to success; People & Culture, Product-driven Revenue Growth, Successful International Expansion, Maintain & Grow our Commercial Journey, and Sustainable Tech Platform for the future.


Bannerflow is a high-growth company and one of Europe's most exciting SaaS companies. We build a Creative Management Platform that allows enterprise brands to create, publish, analyze, and optimize advertising in-house, at scale. As part of the Bannerflow team, you will get the opportunity to work with a creative, enabling, and premium close-based architecture. Our creative management platform serves more than 6 billion ads each month, viewed on 500 million unique devices all over the world.


**About the Role**


We seek a dynamic and proactive Customer Success Manager (CSM) to join our team. In this role, you will manage a portfolio of approximately 25 enterprise customers within a specific market, ensuring successful onboarding, product adoption, and overall satisfaction with the Bannerflow marketing cloud platform. Your mission will include driving customer retention and revenue growth through strategic customer projects, quarterly business reviews, and maintaining high satisfaction levels.

**Key Responsibilities**

* Facilitate a smooth onboarding experience for new customers.
* Drive increased usage and engagement with the Bannerflow platform.
* Lead key customer projects, collaborating with stakeholders to deliver success.
* Conduct regular reviews to assess and enhance customer satisfaction.
* Maintain and improve satisfaction levels across your customer portfolio.
* Achieve revenue growth through retention and upsell initiatives.

**Skills and Competencies**

* 4+ years of experience in Customer Success management roles, with experience in or exposure to the SaaS industry being a strong plus.
* Proven ability to manage and complete customer projects effectively.
* Strong skills in building and maintaining relationships with customers.
* Excellent verbal and written communication skills in English. Any additional language is a bonus.
* Ability to analyze and report on customer data to drive insights.
* Proficient in upselling and negotiating with customers.
* Demonstrates initiative to drive customer success.
* Prioritizes and meets the needs of customers.
* Effective in quickly resolving issues.
* Flexible and responsive to changing customer and business needs.
* Strong understanding of business principles to drive growth.
* Humble, grounded, and collaborative attitude.

**Why join us?**  

We live alongside our values of Collaboration, Passion, and Challenge; with many events going on at Bannerflow such as Health Month, after works, inspiration sessions, workouts, and hackathons, there’s something for everyone. We are committed to building a diverse and inclusive team and welcome applications from candidates of all backgrounds, experiences, and abilities.


We offer a hybrid workplace and a competitive compensation package including pension according to ITP1, health allowance, parental leave top-up, and health care insurance.

title: Data Architect – Infobric Group
description:
*Vi är ett av Sveriges största SaaS-bolag som genom innovativ teknik digitaliserar byggbranschen för att göra den säkrare, mer produktiv och mer hållbar. Hos oss blir du en del av ett kreativt team där du får utvecklas, ta dig an spännande utmaningar och samtidigt ha kul på vägen! Vi söker nu fler kollegor som vill vara med på resan att digitalisera en av världens största branscher och bidra till ett hållbart samhälle.*


Är du en erfaren Data Architect som vill vara med och bygga en innovativ och strategiskt viktig dataplattform? Infobric Group söker nu en Data Architect som ska leda arbetet med att samla in, analysera och kombinera data från våra olika affärsområden som en del av vår agenda att bli ännu mer datadrivna i vår uppföljning av verksamheten och vårt beslutsfattande.

 **Det här kommer du att göra:**  

Som Data Architect på Infobric Group kommer du att ha en central roll i utvecklingen av vår plattform för datainsamling och dataanalys. Du kommer att arbeta nära våra affärsområden och tekniska team för att säkerställa att vi effektivt kan kombinera data över hela organisationen, vilket är ett av våra viktiga strategiska initiativ. Din uppgift blir att säkerställa att datan används för att driva affärsbeslut och skapa värde för både interna och externa intressenter.


Du kommer att:

* Leda arbetet med att designa och implementera vår dataplattform.
* Ansvara för att samla och integrera data från våra affärssystem, produkter och övriga stödsystem från våra olika affärsområden till en sammanhängande datainfrastruktur.
* Arbeta med avancerade dataanalyser och utveckla modeller för att optimera våra affärsprocesser.
* Vara en nyckelspelare i vår digitaliseringsstrategi och bidra till att etablera datadrivna arbetssätt inom hela organisationen.

 **Vad söker vi hos dig:**  

Vi söker dig som har:

* Flera års erfarenhet som Data Architect eller liknande roll, med fokus på dataplattformar och analys.
* Erfarenhet av en eller flera cloud-baserad plattformar så som t ex Snowflake, Google Bigquery, Microsoft Fabric eller liknande.
* Gedigen kunskap inom dataintegration, datalagring och datahantering.
* Starka analytiska färdigheter och förmågan att omvandla data till insikter som driver affärsbeslut.
* Förmåga att samarbeta med tvärfunktionella team och anpassa lösningar efter affärsbehov.

 **Vad vi erbjuder:**  

Som Data Architect på Infobric Group får du möjligheten att vara med och forma framtiden för vår datainfrastruktur och spela en avgörande roll i vår digitaliseringsresa.


Du kommer att arbeta nära koncernledningen och resultatet av ditt arbete kommer att ha stor strategisk betydelse för Infobric. Du kommer att vara en del av en lönsam och växande organisation som sätter hållbarhet och innovation i fokus.

  


**Låter detta som en spännande utmaning för dig? Ansök idag och bli en del av vårt team!**


Sök enkelt med din LinkedInprofil eller bifoga CV. Vi gör löpande urval och tjänsten kan komma att tillsättas snabbt så vänta inte med att skicka in din ansökan!

title: Hybrid Infrastructure Engineer
description:
**Company Description**
 We are in Business for People, empowering people in service organizations with innovative Enterprise and Business software solutions. We’ve innovated and taken a new approach to delivering ERP that works for people. Self-driving, adaptive and intuitive software that is changing the way people work. Our solutions empower people and deliver a better people experience so people can spend time on meaningful high value work they live for.
   

  

 Read more on our website about how we transform work and how people feel about it, so our customers and their people can thrive.
   

  

**Job Description**
 The Global Cloud Infrastructure Team is seeking a skilled Hybrid Cloud Operations Engineer to join our international team. As part of this dynamic team, you will play a key role in supporting our commercial offerings. Unit4 operates a sophisticated infrastructure spanning Microsoft Azure and on-premises data centers in Sweden. In this role, you will primarily work with Windows Server Virtual Machines deployed on VMware while also assisting in the setup of virtual networks and Azure native solutions.
   

  

**Qualifications**
**Required:**
* 3+ years of relevant experience
* General knowledge of Windows Server architecture and Active Directory
* Experience with VMware and virtualization technologies
* Hands-on experience with physical data centers, including cabling, moving components, etc.
* Flexibility to work outside of office hours and participate in weekend on-call support.
* Strong prioritization skills, both independently and as part of a team
* Proficient troubleshooting skills, with the ability to resolve complex issues
* Passion for learning new technologies and exploring innovative ideas
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills for engaging with internal and external customers


**Nice to Have:**
* Familiarity with Microsoft Azure & Microsoft certifications
* Experience with Dell Servers, Cisco Network devices
* Experience automating Windows systems using PowerShell or similar methods
* Knowledge of networking (VPN setup), file transfer servers, Microsoft SQL, and PKI infrastructure
* Experience with AWS


**Additional Information**
* Remote work option
* Employment contract
* Stable employment with an attractive salary
* Unlimited paid holidays
* Various benefits including private medical care, Multisport, and pre-paid cards
* Opportunity to work in an international department and collaborate with colleagues from diverse cultural backgrounds
* Participation in the development of a leading international software firm
* Freedom and autonomy to succeed, with an unlimited vacation policy that focuses on results


 At Unit4, you will join a team of enthusiastic professionals dedicated to personal and professional growth. If you are excited about working in a challenging international environment and making a meaningful impact, we encourage you to apply.
   

  

**This role may require security clearance required for customer projects and access to sensitive (customer) data. That means that after you have accepted our offer, we could ask for background checks. Subject to applicable local laws, such security checks may require disclosure of personal information including criminal record declaration, right to work, personal identification and work history. No worries though – we'll handle it according to local privacy laws and keep your info safe. Questions? Feel free to reach out!**

title: Internship - Cloud Infra Developer
description:
Join our Team
   

  

**About this opportunity:**
 "Are you currently studying and looking to gain real-world experience in the field of DevOps before you graduate? We invite you to join our dynamic team as an intern, where you'll play a role in our ambitious initiative to revolutionize our solution delivery using As-a-Service models on public Hyper Cloud Providers (HCP) in partnership with Google. Our mission is to delight our customers with services they love and give them a competitive edge, while nurturing a "lean and mean" product development organization. If you're passionate about modern product development, inspiring change, and shaping innovative technology, we invite you to take the first step of your career adventure with us!
   

  

**Why Join Our Team?**
* Innovative Atmosphere: Immerse yourself in a creative, forward-thinking environment dedicated to transforming the way we approach software.
* Collaborative Culture: Work alongside professional engineers who share your passion for technology and innovation.
* Purposeful Impact: Contribute to the future of our products and directly influence the experience of developers across our global organization.
* Psychological Safety: Experience a supportive environment where you can experiment, express ideas, and learn from mistakes without fear of negative consequences.
* Career Development: We are committed to your growth, offering valuable learning experiences and skill enhancement opportunities.
* Boundless Opportunities: Your innovative ideas will be encouraged and can become the driving force behind our continuous integration, delivery, and deployment efforts.


**What you will do:**
* Learn and Grow: Participate in designing, implementing, and managing cloud-based infrastructure solutions as part of an agile team, ensuring tools and infrastructures are robust and scalable.
* Collaborate: Partner with development teams and Google to tackle infrastructure challenges and support the delivery of our high-quality SaaS offering.
* Stay Informed: Keep yourself updated with industry-standard methodologies and emerging technologies.
* Contribute to the Team: Engage in an agile team using Lean, Agile, and DevOps methodologies and tools, enhancing continuous integration, delivery, and deployment practices.


**The skills you bring:**
* A strong passion for technology and a keen desire to learn and grow in cloud infrastructure management.
* Good problem-solving skills and the ability to work collaboratively in a team setting.
* Basic understanding of cloud platforms like AWS, Azure, or GCP, with a focus on GCP as our primary cloud provider. Academic experience or certifications in GCP are highly valued.
* Familiarity with DevOps principles and tools such as Jenkins, GitLab CI/CD, or GitHub Actions.
* Knowledge or academic experience with containerization technologies like Docker and Kubernetes is a plus.
* Excellent communication skills and the ability to thrive in a fast-paced environment.


**Why join Ericsson?**
 At Ericsson, you´ll have an outstanding opportunity. The chance to use your skills and imagination to push the boundaries of what´s possible. To build solutions never seen before to some of the world’s toughest problems. You´ll be challenged, but you won’t be alone. You´ll be joining a team of diverse innovators, all driven to go beyond the status quo to craft what comes next.
   

  

**What happens once you apply?**
 Click Here to find all you need to know about what our typical hiring process looks like.
   

  

 Encouraging a diverse and inclusive organization is core to our values at Ericsson, that's why we champion it in everything we do. We truly believe that by collaborating with people with different experiences we drive innovation, which is essential for our future growth. We encourage people from all backgrounds to apply and realize their full potential as part of our Ericsson team. Ericsson is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. learn more.
   

  

**Primary country and city:** 
 Sweden (SE) || Stockholm
   

  

**Req ID:** 
 757585

title: Chief Technology Officer
description:
RoadBird is a cutting-edge fintech platform transforming fleet management for the ride-share industry. With advanced payroll processing, operational insights, and a new drive-to-own initiative, we’re scaling rapidly and looking for a technical leader to guide our development.
 



  





**Role Summary** 




 As CTO, you’ll take full ownership of our code repositories and hosting environments, leading the development team and ensuring all systems are optimized for scalability and security. You’ll design, manage, and maintain RoadBird’s technical infrastructure, from CI/CD pipelines to API integrations, and champion AI applications in our products.
 



  





**Key Responsibilities** 



* **Repository & Environment Management** 
 : Full oversight of code repositories and hosting setups, ensuring optimal remote development workflows.
* **Development Team Leadership** 
 : Manage a high-performance coding team, setting standards for quality, scalability, and security.
* **CI/CD Pipeline Development** 
 : Design, implement, and maintain CI/CD processes, with packaging knowledge across diverse environments.
* **Cloud Infrastructure** 
 : Extensive experience with AWS, Azure, Google Cloud, including billing, budgeting, and cost optimization.
* **Security** 
 : Expertise with OpenSSL, certificate deployment, dynamic credential storage, and secure environment variable setups.
* **API Development** 
 : Deep understanding of APIs, structured JSON, and multi-layered API integrations.
* **AI Engineering** 
 : Advanced knowledge in prompt and system prompt engineering, fine-tuning, and AI model development.
* **Data Handling** 
 : Skilled in parsing and processing data from CSV, XLS, JSON, web scraping, and other formats.



  





**Technical Skills** 



* **Programming Languages** 
 : Proficiency in Python, Java, Scala, JavaScript, TypeScript, React, and frameworks in each.
* **Cloud & DevOps** 
 : Strong experience with AWS, Azure, and Google Cloud, including setup, scaling, and optimization.
* **Security Protocols** 
 : Advanced understanding of OpenSSL, certificate management, and secure environment configurations.



  





**Qualifications** 



* **Experience** 
 : Proven track record in senior technology roles, ideally within fintech or similar high-growth tech ventures in the Nordics or Europe.
* **Strategic Leadership** 
 : Ability to architect and implement scalable, resilient systems and infrastructures with a vision for future growth.
* **AI Innovation** 
 : Experience building AI applications with user-friendly interfaces and practical everyday utility, incorporating automated decision-making for efficient and intuitive outcomes.
* **Commitment** 
 : Full-time availability with no other significant engagements, dedicated to driving RoadBird’s technology roadmap.
* **Investment Readiness** 
 : Capacity to make a primary investment in RoadBird, ideally supported by capital from prior successful exits.



  





**Offering & Compensation** 



* **Base Salary** 
 : Competitive base salary, which will scale with RoadBird’s growth.
* **Equity Package** 
 : Ownership through a structured equity vesting schedule, sharing in the long-term success of the company.
* **High-Growth Environment** 
 : Join a company with substantial market potential, where you can make a significant impact.

title: Infrastrukturspecialist inom Azure
description:
Vill du bli en nyckelspelare i vår kunds IT-driftorganisation? Vi söker en erfaren IT-Infrastrukturtekniker med bred kompetens inom drift, support och underhåll av komplexa IT-miljöer, med särskilt fokus på molninfrastruktur och erfarenhet inom Azure. I denna roll får du ansvar för att säkerställa driften av hela IT-infrastrukturen och bidra i spännande projekt som sträcker sig från klassisk mainframe till moderna molnlösningar och hybridmiljöer.
 



 Vi söker dig som brinner för att göra skillnad och vill ta en central roll i våra kunduppdrag. Du kommer att arbeta i hela livscykeln – från planering och implementation av Azure-miljöer till underhåll och förbättring av molnbaserade IT-lösningar. Erfarenhet av att sätta upp, hantera och optimera servrar i Azure, samt integration av molntjänster med övrig infrastruktur, är en viktig del av rollen. Här får du chansen att kombinera teknik, innovation och utveckling i en roll som verkligen gör avtryck.
   





**För den här rollen ser vi att du har:** 



* Erfarenhet av avancerad drift och underhåll av större komplexa T-miljöer, med fokus på Azure och relaterade tjänster.
* Erfarenhet av Microsoft, både server och klient.
* Djupgående erfarenhet av Microsoft Azure, inklusive hantering av virtuella maskiner, nätverk, lagring och säkerhetslösningar.
* Erfarenhet av Microsoft 365, inklusive konfiguration och administration av användare, tjänster och säkerhetspolicys inom EntraID och Intune.
* Erfarenhet av serverdrift i VMware, med integration mot Azure för hybridlösningar och hantering av virtuella resurser i både on-prem och molnmiljöer.
* Nätverk (Cisco CCNA eller motsvarande).
* Erfarenhet av brandväggsregler och att ständigt förbättra säkerheten i miljön.
* PowerShell skripting.
* Erfarenhet av att delta eller leda IT-projekt för att implementera nya lösningar.
* Kunskap om IT-säkerhet, ITIL och agila arbetsmetoder.
* Flytande i tal och skrift i både svenska och engelska.



**Meriterande:**



* Om du har gått kurser eller innehar certifikat inom relevanta områden.
* Om du har erfarenhet av automationssystem (PLC, SCADA).







**Start** 
 : Omgående start med hänsyn till uppsägningstid. Uppdraget är på heltid och är tillsvidare
   





**Placeringsort:** 
 Stockholm
 



**Ansökan:** 
 Intervjuer sker löpande och tillsättning sker vid rätt match
   

  





**Vad vi står för:**
 Vi på Camai erbjuder ett av marknadens branschledande anställningsvillkor med stor frihet som ledord. Vi drivs av att hitta det bästa uppdraget för våra medarbetare. Det roligaste som finns är att hitta en perfekt matchning mellan konsult och kund. Vi vet att alla har ett drömarbete, och vi är ett tight entreprenörsdrivet team som arbetar för att se till att du tycker att det är roligt att gå till jobbet, varje dag. Vi tror att kompetenta människor dras till varandra och vill jobba med likasinnade i spännande kunduppdrag.
 



 Vi har en av marknadens mest förmånliga ersättningsmodell anpassad för en modern konsultorganisation med mycket frihet. Vi har helt enkelt kul tillsammans!
   





**Varför ska du välja oss?**
 Med många års erfarenhet i konsultbranschen har vi valt våra tre värdeord med omsorg; kommunikation, ambition och balans. För att lyckas tror vi att våra medarbetare får vara med och forma sitt arbete efter prioriteringar och intresse i livet. Med din ambition och rätt verktyg från oss ser vi till att du utvecklas och samtidigt belönas på vägen.
   





*Vill du vara en del av vår fortsatta tillväxt?*

title: Microsoft 365-konsult
description:
I rollen som Microsoft 365-konsult hos B3 Cloud får du möjlighet att vara en central del i våra kunders arbete med den moderna arbetsplatsen. Du blir inte bara rådgivare utan också en viktig länk i vårt interna nätverk av experter inom Microsofts teknologier.
   

  

 Dina arbetsuppgifter blir både utmanande och givande:
   

  

* Ansvara för att definiera, planera och genomföra migreringar samt utveckla kundens Office 365-miljö inom våra projekt.
* Hantera incidenter, implementera nya lösningar, bevaka uppdateringar från Microsoft och underhålla nära samarbeten med kunder och kollegor.
* Driva utvecklingen av kundens tekniska miljö, inkludera nya funktioner och uppdateringar i Microsoft 365.


 Vi tror att du kanske har en bakgrund inom IT och/eller erfarenhet av Microsoft 365. Du har tidigare varit konsult. Ditt proaktiva, strukturerade arbete och starka kundfokus är vad som gör dig idealisk för denna roll. Du förstår konsten att både förstå och utmana kundens behov på ett konstruktivt sätt. Du trivs med att arbeta självständigt likväl som i team, och du behärskar både svenska och engelska flytande.
   

  

 Bli del av vår framgång: Vi erbjuder en spännande tjänst i en växande organisation där ditt bidrag är avgörande. Som del av vårt team, kommer du att arbeta nära dina kollegor, i en kultur som präglas av energi, hjälpsamhet och strävan att göra skillnad. Vi värdesätter flexibiliteten att kunna styra vår egen vardag och satsa på medarbetarnas utveckling. Vi uppskattar även social samvaro och anordnar årliga konferensresor, sommarfester och julfiranden.
   

  

 Om oss: Som experter på molnteknik och den digitala arbetsplatsen av morgondagen, bistår B3 Cloud våra kunder i övergången från traditionell infrastruktur till molnet. Vi erbjuder analyser, planering, migrering och förvaltning av IT-miljöer, och hjälper till att skapa modern samverkan med Microsoft 365. Vi är stolta över att vara både Guldpartner och Cloud Service Provider (CSP) för Microsoft.
   

  

 Är du intresserad? Skicka in din ansökan idag för en chans att bli en del av vårt team! Har du frågor eller funderingar, tveka inte att kontakta Melinda på melinda.andersson@b3.se.
   

  

**Vi ser fram emot din ansökan!**
*B3 Cloud är en del av B3-koncernen, utsedd till Sveriges tredje bästa arbetsplats 2021 av Great Place to Work, och till Sveriges IT Karriärföretag 2022. Våra värdeord är erfarenhet, olikheter och energi. Vi arbetar för hållbarhet i alla led och tror på att medarbetare som mår bra presterar bättre. Därför arrangerar vi regelbundna wellness-aktiviteter som yoga, simning, löpning, musikquiz, stickcafé och föreläsningar om stress och mental hälsa."*

title: Machine Learning Engineer
description:
We now have a new requirement and are looking for a consultant colleague with the qualifications listed below. The position is part of our consulting business, which means you will be employed by us and work either with clients or on internal projects and assignments.
   

  

*As part of your application, you may be presented to clients/partners as part of the recruitment process. If selected for the assignment, you will be employed by us and work either with clients or on internal projects and assignments as part of our consulting business.*
**GCP requirements:**
* Familiar with BigQuery, can code SQL
* Familiar with Cloud composer / airflow
* Familiar with IAM, service account
* Familiar with Data catalog
* Understand Infrastructure as Code
* Good to have knowledge with Dataflow, K8s, Vertex AI pipeline, Kubeflow pipeline


**Cloud diagnostic skills:**
* Deep knowledge about python programing, practice OOP, following coding best practice, know how to use flake8, mypy, black, SonarQube and pre-commit
* Deep knowledge in unit test and end to end test, familiar with Pytest, fixtures, unittest etc


**Unix:**
* Familiar with popular Unix system, know how to install sth in docker.
* Familiar with shell


**Git:**
* Know how to create PR and solve merge conflict.
* Can create CI/CD pipeline in either Github Action or Azure DevOps using best practice


**Docker:**
* Deep understanding with Docker


**DBT:**
* Deep Knowledge in DBT, preferably with GCP


**SQL:**
* Deep knowledge of SQL
* Deep understanding with Data modeling, system design


**Application deadline:** 
 27-11-2024
   

  

**About Us**
 We currently employ experienced consultants in areas such as System Development, AI, Machine Learning, Testing, Cloud, Infra DevOps, and IT Project Management.
   

  

 Working at Deploja is something entirely different from working at an ordinary consulting company—and we are really proud of that. So, what makes us unique?
   

  

 We simply offer more than just a high salary and greater freedom; that’s just the beginning. With us, you’ll find the work environment and opportunities you deserve. Welcome to Deploja, where the grass is indeed greener!
   

  

**Vi erbjuder dig följande, Valet är ditt!**
 🚀 Exciting assignments with our many clients. We focus on long-term projects, which gives you the opportunity to create value for the client while also developing yourself.
   

  

 🌟 A secure monthly salary – together we’ll agree on a base salary depending on your assignments.
   

  

 🚗 Company car – we encourage you to choose an electric car for a more sustainable future.
   

  

 💼 Occupational pension and great opportunities for salary conversion.
   

  

 🌴 Vacation – Would you like more than 30 days of vacation, perhaps 60 days?
   

  

 🏥 Private health insurance, accident insurance, and life insurance for increased security.
   

  

 📚 Skills development – you set your own budget and choose the training you wish to attend.
   

  

 🕑 Quality of life – Are you struggling to balance everyday life and wish to work a little less while still earning as much, if not more?
   

  

*We handle applications continuously, and due to the high workload, it's especially important to include a short motivation for the position, explaining how you meet the requirements.*

title: SRE / Observability Engineer
description:
* Help design, build and continuously improve the clients online platform.
* Research, suggest and implement new technology solutions following best practices/standards.
* Take responsibility for the resiliency and availability of different products.
* Be a productive member of the team.


**Requirements**
* Proficient in leveraging Grafana and Prometheus for comprehensive observability.
* Expertise in configuring and monitoring applications in Azure.


**Benefits**
* A challenging, innovating environment.
* Opportunities for learning where needed.

title: Hybrid Cloud Solutions Sales Specialist
description:
This role has been designed as ‘Hybrid’ with an expectation that you will work on average 2-3 days per week from an HPE office.
   

  

**Who We Are**
 Hewlett Packard Enterprise is the global edge-to-cloud company advancing the way people live and work. We help companies connect, protect, analyze, and act on their data and applications wherever they live, from edge to cloud, so they can turn insights into outcomes at the speed required to thrive in today’s complex world. Our culture thrives on finding new and better ways to accelerate what’s next. We know diverse backgrounds are valued and succeed here. We have the flexibility to manage our work and personal needs. We make bold moves, together, and are a force for good. If you are looking to stretch and grow your career our culture will embrace you. Open up opportunities with HPE.
   

  

**Job Description**
 We are looking for a Sales Specialist for our Hybrid Cloud Solutions Team in Sweden, focused on selling and positioning our extensive portfolio of Hybrid Solutions.
   

  

 Over the past years HPE have invested significantly into R&D and acquisitions for new technologies building HPE GreenLake and our Hybrid Solutions software and services portfolio. HPE GreenLake brings the cloud experience to all your IT. Unlike public cloud, HPE GreenLake is a hybrid cloud by design. You can deploy, automate and manage resources across your private and public clouds while retaining control of your data.
   

  

**As a Hybrid Cloud Solution Sales Specialist, You**
* Will have named accounts allocated to you.
* Are accountable for quota fulfillment and regular forecast on assigned accounts and solutions.
* Daily engage with existing and new customers (hunting), on your own but in close collaboration with wider sales team and supported by technical Solution Architects
* Develop pursuit plans, build, qualify, and manage a well-founded, long-term pipeline to meet sales targets and increase the HPE market share.
* Challenge customers status quo focusing on the business outcomes to position HPE’s Hybrid Cloud solutions and services as an element of their IT transformation and digitization strategy
* Translate product and services knowledge into customer's added business value
* Gain understanding of the end customer's business drivers to implement customer requirements in sustainable HPE business via a comprehensive consulting approach at all levels of the customer
* Foster and expand existing and develop new relationships with technical and business stakeholders at customers to gain share of mind and expand HPE’s footprint
* Lead business opportunities over the entire lifecycle from initial contact, PoCs, preparation and response to tenders, negotiations to the conclusion of the contract.


**If you are…**
* Good at building trust, innovating and making things happen? Good start, you are aligned to our core values!


**If You Have These Skills, Expertise, Attitude And Education…**
* Minimum 5 years sales experience with complex IT solutions and services owning the responsibility for the sales result.
* Very good knowledge of the IT market in general, with experience in Cloud technologies, SaaS/Subscription and Managed services.
* Reliability in building a sales pipeline, forecasting and customer management (sales excellence)
* Distinctive customer orientation and consulting skills combined with assertiveness, mentality to challenge a customer’s status quo
* Strong business and financial acumen, combined with technology skills
* Team and goal-oriented work
* Creativity, initiative, and reliability
* Negotiation
* Excellent communication, presentation and closing skills
* Business fluency in Swedish and English language


**Come and join the future of** 
**Hybrid Cloud Solutions and HPE!**

title: Azure Data Architect
description:
Data Architect is responsible for designing the overall data infrastructure ensuring that it can support both current and future business needs This role is crucial for setting up a scalable and secure architecture that can handle large datasets real time analytics and integration with multiple systems The architect will define how data flows between D365 FO other integrated systems and data platform on Azure
 



**Key responsibilities include**




 ·      Designing Data Architecture Creating the blueprint for data storage integration and access across the organization with a focus on scalability security and performance
 



 ·      RealTime Data Architecture Architecting systems that support realtime data ingestion and processing enabling realtime analytics capabilities
 



 ·      Technology Stack Selection Evaluating and selecting appropriate Azure services and tools eg Azure Data Factory Fabric Databricks Synapse Analytics to meet data storage processing and reporting needs
 



 ·      Data Modeling Designing logical and physical data models that reflect the organizations business processes and support analytics and reporting requirements
 



 ·      Data Security Compliance Ensuring data security privacy and compliance eg GDPR financial regulations are embedded into the architecture
 



**Key Skills**




 ·      Technical Expertise Proficiency in Azure cloud services Azure Data Lake Synapse Analytics SQL Database data integration tools Azure Data Factory and realtime data processing architectures
 



 ·      D365 FO Knowledge Deep understanding of D365 FO data structures entities and integration points to ensure seamless data flow from the D365 FO to data platform
 



 ·      Data Modeling Expertise in creating both relational and dimensional data models that align with business needs especially in procurement and finance domains
 



 ·      Data Lakehouse Concepts Experience with implementing a lakehouse architecture which combines the scalability of a data lake with the performance of a data warehouse eg using Azure Synapse Analytics. Also knows how to work with Delta Lake tables
 



 ·      Security Compliance Knowledge of data security frameworks encryption and compliance requirements particularly in finance and procurement
 



 ·      Leadership Collaboration Ability to work closely with Data Engineers BI Developers and business stakeholders to ensure the architecture aligns with business goals
