Software Associate
description:
About the role
 
 Are you ready to dive into the heart of software development and help shape the future of a rapidly growing startup? At
 **idele** 
 , we’re looking for a passionate and ambitious
 **Software Associate** 
 to join our dynamic team. This role is all about exploration, growth, and making a tangible impact.
 



  





 You’ll wear many hats—tackling frontend interfaces, backend logic, database structures, and even workflows involving cutting-edge technologies like LLMs. This isn’t just a stepping stone; it’s a chance to roll up your sleeves, experiment, and grow alongside a team dedicated to democratizing marketing for businesses everywhere. If you’re someone who thrives in collaborative, innovative environments and wants to help shape the next big thing in marketing tech, we’d love to hear from you.
 



  





  




**What you'll do** 

  





 As a Software Associate at 
 **idele** 
 , you’ll take on a variety of responsibilities that will help you grow as a developer and contribute to the success of our platform. Here’s what we’ll rely on you to do:
 



  




* Dive into various facets of software development, from creating intuitive frontend interfaces to designing robust backend systems.
* Collaborate with our team to develop scalable features and ensure seamless integrations across our platform.
* Work on workflows involving LLMs, reasoning models, and data inference to push the boundaries of what our platform can achieve.
* Build and maintain efficient database structures that support the evolving needs of our platform and users.
* Explore cutting-edge tools and frameworks to refine and enhance idele’s capabilities.
* Support cloud-based infrastructure (Google Cloud Platform) for reliable, scalable deployment.
* Partner with designers, engineers, and stakeholders to transform bold ideas into impactful solutions.



  





  




**Preferably you are...** 

  




* Driven by curiosity and ambition, always eager to learn, grow, and explore new challenges.
* Someone who thrives on a hands-on approach, ready to tackle problems head-on and turn ideas into reality.
* A natural collaborator who values teamwork and sees the power in diverse perspectives.
* Excited by the opportunity to work across multiple areas of development, embracing innovation and flexibility.
* Able to balance a visionary mindset with a keen eye for detail, delivering high-quality results.
* Passionate about technology and motivated to create impactful, future-forward solutions.



  





  




**Preferably you have...** 

  




* A solid understanding of both frontend and backend development, with experience in frameworks like React, Node.js, or similar.
* Familiarity with database design and management, including relational or NoSQL systems.
* Experience working with cloud platforms, ideally Google Cloud, for scalable infrastructure.
* Exposure to workflows involving Large Language Models (LLMs), data inference, or reasoning models.
* A track record of experimenting with new technologies and applying them to solve real-world problems.
* Strong problem-solving skills, with the ability to debug and optimize systems efficiently.
* Knowledge of modern software development practices, from deployment pipelines to collaborative tools like Git.



  





  




**What's in it for you?** 

  





**Growth opportunity:** 




 Be part of a fast-growing startup where you’ll have the chance to explore multiple areas of software development and grow your skills across the stack.
 



  





**Make an impact:** 




 Contribute directly to building a platform that empowers small businesses and transforms the marketing landscape.
 



  





**Inviting culture:** 




 Excel in an agile and flexible work environment that wants you to explore new ideas that has the potential to directly have an impact on the company's direction and success.
 



  





**Competitive incentives:** 




 We value your dedication and creativity, offering a suite of benefits tailored to nurture your professional growth and the unique opportunity to be part of our journey from the beginning.
 



  





**Design your work life:** 




 We value flexibility and balance. Shape your working style around your life, in an environment that supports your well-being and productivity.
 



  





  




**About idele** 

  





 At idele, we believe that every business deserves a fair shot at success. In a world dominated by complex marketing tools and steep learning curves, small and medium-sized businesses often struggle to reach their audiences. We're here to change that.
 



  





 Our mission is to democratize marketing by empowering every business—regardless of size or resources—with the tools to deliver personalized experiences, relevant information, and inspirational messaging at each stage of the customer journey. We aim to transform audiences into loyal customers with ease.
 



  





 We're passionate about making marketing accessible, practical, and straightforward. We're not about gimmicks or fluff—just functional tools designed to empower businesses. We're a small, collaborative team that values innovation, teamwork, and accountability. We take our work seriously, but not ourselves.
 



  





 Learn more about the role on our website:
 



 https://idele.com/careers/software-associate/

title: Backend Software Engineer (.Net Core)
description:
**About Sinch**
 Sinch is pioneering the way the world communicates. More than 150,000 businesses — including Google, Uber, Paypal, Visa, Tinder, and many others — rely on Sinch's Customer Communications Cloud to power engaging customer experiences through mobile messaging, voice, and email.
   

  

 Whether you need to verify users or craft omnichannel campaigns, Sinch makes it easy. Our AI-infused Super Network, APIs, and applications ensure you can connect with your customers reliably and securely, at every step of their journey.
   

  

 At Sinch we "Dream Big", "Win Together", "Keep it simple", and "Make it Happen". These values are our foundation!
   

  

**Description**
* Create systems that are not only scalable but also resilient, ensuring graceful failure.
* Manage the software lifecycle from design and development to testing and production deployment.
* Work with a range of different technologies and programming languages, but primarily with C# and .NET Core.
* Actively contribute to enhancing our development processes and pipelines.
* Take a hands-on approach to monitoring production environments, identifying issues, and being on-call when necessary.
* Engage closely with software engineers, architects, DevOps specialists, and product managers to deliver exceptional products.


**Requirements**
* Experienced professional in team-based development, deployment, and maintenance of software products in production.
* In-depth knowledge of .NET Core and a deep passion for technology.
* Strong written and verbal communication skills in English.
* Ability to work effectively within a cross-functional self-organizing team, fostering collaboration and mutual respect among team members.
* A passion for writing clean and testable code.
* Bachelor's degree in computer science or related technical discipline.


**Good to have**
* Experience in a similar industry or related one.
* Experience working with service-oriented architecture and distributed systems.
* Experience with Kubernetes or similar technologies.
* Experience working with AWS.
* Proven ability to work with others to solve tough technical problems.
* Ability to thrive in a dynamic and fast-paced work environment characteristic of agile development methodologies.
* Experience guiding and mentoring fellow developers empowering them to contribute effectively to team goals.


 Embrace the challenge and join us!
   

  

**Our Hiring Process**
 We are committed to ensuring a recruitment process that is fair, objective, consistent, and inclusive. Our approach includes structured, competency-based interviews designed to evaluate your skills, experience, and qualifications relevant to the role. At times, we may include a data-driven assessment to enhance our hiring success and identify candidates likely to excel.
   

  

 We believe in a two-way process and encourage you to ask questions throughout the journey. If this role isn't what you're looking for, please explore the other opportunities listed on our career page: https://www.sinch.com/careers/. No matter who you are, we hope you find an exciting path forward - hopefully with us!

title: Information Architect
description:
**I** 
**nformationsarkitekter till B3** 
**Visab Consulting**
 Hos B3 Visab Consulting stödjer vi finansindustrins utveckling i den digitala ekonomin. Vi söker nu fler engagerade informationsarkitekter som vill vara med och bidra till en samhällskritisk bransch. Med över 40 års erfarenhet har vi byggt långsiktiga relationer med ledande aktörer inom bank och försäkring, och vår expertis gör oss även till en attraktiv partner för snabbväxande företag.
   

  

**Om rollen** 
 Som informationsarkitekt hos oss får du arbeta i varierande uppdrag där du hjälper kunder att utveckla och implementera robust informationsarkitektur. Du kommer att:
   

  

* Skapa riktlinjer och standarder för informationsarkitekturens struktur.
* Sätta upp processer för att hantera och vidareutveckla informationsflöden.
* Säkerställa att rätt information når rätt personer vid rätt tidpunkt.
* Arbeta med datalagring, tillgänglighet och säkerhet för att förhindra obehörig åtkomst och dataförluster.


 Vi tror att framgång bygger på samarbete och kunskapsdelning och vi ser gärna att du är en lagspelare som uppskattar att arbeta prestigelöst och flexibelt.
   

  

**Vi söker dig som har:**
* Minst 3 års erfarenhet som informationsarkitekt eller enterprisearkitekt, med fokus på informationsstruktur.
* Minst 2 års erfarenhet från bank- eller försäkringssektorn.
* Tidigare erfarenhet som konsult.
* Goda kunskaper i svenska och engelska, både i tal och skrift.
* Certifieringar inom relevanta områden är meriterande, liksom erfarenhet som verksamhetsarkitekt.


**Vi erbjuder:**
* Attraktiv och flexibel lönemodell.
* Möjlighet att påverka dina arbetstider och arbetsplats.
* Tillgång till utbildningar och certifieringar för din professionella utveckling.
* En stark wellness-satsning genom Team B3, som främjar både hälsa och arbetsglädje.


**Varför B3** 
 Visab? Vi är en del av B3 Consulting Group, ett av Sveriges snabbast växande företag inom IT och management. Hos oss får du det bästa av två världar: kraften från ett stort bolag och den personliga samhörigheten från ett mindre. Vi är stolta över att ha blivit erkända som "Årets Karriärföretag" och av "Great Place to Work". Våra medarbetare pratar om friheten att påverka sina uppdrag, arbetsmiljön där olikheter välkomnas, och stoltheten över att bidra till både kunders framgång och samhället i stort. Vi samarbetar med initiativ som Women in Tech, Changers Hub och Pink Programming för att göra skillnad.
   

  

**Kontakt** 
 :
   

  

 Är du redo att ta nästa steg i din karriär? Ansök nu! Har du frågor är du välkommen att kontakta Lidia Hagos (lidia.hagos@b3.se) eller konsultchef Hanna Skoog (+4670-260 12 65).

title: Senior Områdesarkitekt
description:
Vi har nu ett nytt behov och söker därför en konsultkollega med nedan kvalifikationer. Tjänsten är en del av vår konsultverksamhet vilket innebär att du blir anställd av oss och arbetar hos kund alt. interna projekt och åtaganden.
 *I samband med din ansökan kan du komma att presenteras för kund/partner som en del av rekryteringsprocessen. Om du blir utvald för uppdraget, kommer du att anställas av oss och arbeta antingen hos kund eller i interna projekt och åtaganden som en del av vår konsultverksamhet.*
**Jobbeskrivning**
 Agera områdesarkitekt i arbetet med att vidareutveckla den centrala loggplattformen för nuvarande ändamål i en Multi Tenant miljö där flera är slutkund inom audit, infrastruktur, it-säkerhet, SOC, samt verksamhetsapplikationer. Möjliggöra kostnadseffektiva lösningar. Rollen har vissa stöttande operationella delar till teamet men är huvudsak icke-operationell. Rollen kräver också att man interagerar med andra team inom området.
   

  

**Din profil (Skall krav)**
* Minst 10 års arbetslivserfarenhet av arkitektroll inom stora Splunk Enterprisemiljöer
* Minst 10 års arbetslivserfarenhet av att jobba med on-prem infrastruktur
* Minst 10 års arbetslivserfarenhet av nätarkitektur, nätverkssäkerhet och it-säkerhet
* Du skall ha minst 5 års arbetslivserfarenhet där du har jobbat med vägval vid införande av tekniska lösningar och ha förståelse för konsekvenser av dessa
* Du skall kunna förklara och konkretisera tekniska lösningar till både verksamhet och tekniska personer såsom utvecklare och arkitekter och chefer


**Meriterande**
* Kompetens inom CLP platformen.
* Arbetslivserfarenhet på myndighet med minst 10.000 medarbetare.
* Tidigare erfarenhet att jobba med multi-tenanta lösningar för flertalet slutkunder
* Förståelse och erfarenhet av systemutveckling och dess behov av infrastruktur
* Du innehar kompetens kring system- och applikationsövervakning där loggning ingår


**Sista ansökningdatum:** 
 26-11-2024
   

  

**Om Deploja**
 Vi sysselsätter idag erfarna konsulter, inom bl.a. Systemutveckling, AI, Machine Learning, Test, Cloud, Infra DevOps, , IT-Projektledning.
   

  

 Att jobba på Deploja är något helt annat än att arbeta på ett vanligt konsultbolag – och det är vi riktigt stolta över. Vad är det då som gör oss unika?
   

  

 Vi erbjuder helt enkelt mer än bara hög lön och större frihet, det är bara början. Hos oss hittar du den arbetsmiljö och de möjligheter du förtjänar. Välkommen till Deploja, där gräset faktiskt är grönare!
   

  

**Vi erbjuder dig följande, Valet är ditt!**
 🚀 Spännande uppdrag hos våra många kunder. Vi fokuserar på långsiktiga uppdrag, vilket ger dig möjlighet att skapa värde för kunden samtidigt som du utvecklas själv.
   

  

 🌟 En trygg månadslön – tillsammans bestämmer vi en grundlön baserad på dina uppdrag.
   

  

 🚗 Tjänstebil – vi uppmuntrar dig att välja en elbil för en mer hållbar framtid.
   

  

 💼 Tjänstepension och stora möjligheter till löneväxling.
   

  

 🌴 Semester - Önskar du mer än 30 dagar semester, kanske 60 dagar?
   

  

 🏥 Privat sjukvårdsförsäkring, olycksfallsförsäkring och livförsäkring för ökad trygghet.
   

  

 📚 Kompetensutveckling – du får själv sätta din budget och välja vilka utbildningar du vill delta i.
   

  

 🕑 Livskvalitet - Har du kanske svårt att få ihop pusslet i vardagen och önskar arbeta lite mindre och ändå kunna tjäna lika mycket om inte mer?
   

  

* Vi hanterar ansökningar löpande, med hänsyn till höga arbetstrycket är det extra viktigt med en kort motivering för tjänsten som förklarar hur man möter kraven.

title: Senior System Verification Engineer
description:
Transport is at the core of modern society. Imagine using your expertise to shape sustainable transport and infrastructure solutions for the future? If you seek to make a difference on a global scale, working with next-gen technologies and the sharpest collaborative teams, then we could be a perfect match.

**Role overview**
-----------------


As a **Senior System Verification Engineer**, you will play a critical role in defining, developing, and executing verification strategies for our embedded systems. Your responsibilities will range from crafting detailed verification plans to leading test execution and analysis, ensuring that all system components meet the highest functional and safety standards.  

  

You will collaborate closely with system architects, software engineers, and hardware teams to define and refine verification requirements that align with system specifications. Your role will involve selecting the right verification tools and methodologies, from formal verification and simulation to emulation, while also developing custom testing environments and automation scripts to improve efficiency.

**Key responsibilities**
------------------------

* **Verification Strategy Development:**
	+ Develop and maintain a comprehensive verification strategy, including test plans, test cases, and coverage analysis.
	+ Define and implement verification methodologies and processes, such as formal verification, simulation, and emulation.
	+ Collaborate with system architects and software engineers to ensure verification requirements align with system specifications.

* **Verification Toolchain:**
	+ Select and configure appropriate verification tools and frameworks, including simulators, emulators, and formal verification tools.
	+ Develop and maintain custom verification environments and scripts to automate testing processes.

* **Verification Execution and Analysis:**
	+ Oversee the execution of verification activities, including test case development, test execution, and defect tracking.
	+ Analyze verification results to identify potential issues and risks, and work with development teams to resolve them.
	+ Track and report on verification progress, metrics, and coverage.

* **Team Leadership and Mentoring:**
	+ Lead and mentor a team of verification engineers, providing technical guidance and support.
	+ Foster a culture of quality and continuous improvement within the verification team.

* **Collaboration:**
	+ Collaborate closely with system architects, software engineers, and hardware engineers to ensure seamless integration of verification efforts.
	+ Work with cross-functional teams to identify and address verification challenges.
**What we’re looking for**
--------------------------


We are seeking a technically skilled individual with a solid background in embedded systems and software development processes. You should be comfortable working with various verification methodologies—whether it’s unit testing, integration testing, or system-level verification—and possess a deep understanding of tools and languages used for verification, such as Vector CAN tools and formal verification platforms.

  

  

Your experience in scripting (Python, Perl, CAPL, C#) will allow you to automate testing processes and create efficient verification environments. You’ll need excellent problem-solving skills and the ability to analyze complex data and results.  

As a Senior System Verification Engineer, you’ll not only execute verification activities but also lead and mentor a team of engineers. Good leadership skills, the ability to guide technical teams, and a passion for fostering a culture of quality are essential. Additionally, your collaborative mindset will help you work seamlessly across functions to address challenges and ensure that verification efforts are tightly integrated into the overall development process.

**Preferred qualifications**
----------------------------


While not required, we would particularly value candidates with experience in the **automotive industry** and a familiarity with industry standards and certification processes such as **ISO 26262**. A solid understanding of **formal verification techniques** and experience with **continuous integration (CI/CD) pipelines** will be advantageous.  

  

Experience in **advanced verification techniques**, including constrained-random verification and coverage-driven verification, will set you apart, as will any knowledge of emerging AI or machine learning-based verification methods.  

If you hold a **Product Owner** certification, that would also be an asset, helping you to contribute more effectively to cross-functional initiatives and ensuring alignment with business priorities.

  

We value your data privacy and therefore do not accept applications via mail.

 **Who we are and what we believe in**  

Our focus on Inclusion, Diversity, and Equity allows each of us the opportunity to bring our full authentic self to work and thrive by providing a safe and supportive environment, free of harassment and discrimination. We are committed to removing the barriers to entry, which is why we ask that even if you feel you may not meet every qualification on the job description, please apply and let us decide.

  

Applying to this job offers you the opportunity to join **Volvo Group.** Every day, across the globe, our trucks, buses, engines, construction equipment, financial services, and solutions make modern life possible. We are almost 100,000 people empowered to shape the future landscape of efficient, safe and sustainable transport solutions. Fulfilling our mission creates countless career opportunities for talents with sharp minds and passion across the group’s leading brands and entities.

 **Group Trucks Technology** are seeking talents to help design sustainable transportation solutions for the future. As part of our team, you’ll help us by engineering exciting next-gen technologies and contribute to projects that determine new, sustainable solutions. Bring your love of developing systems, working collaboratively, and your advanced skills to a place where you can make an impact. Join our design shift that leaves society in good shape for the next generation.
company_description: Every day, we work with some of the sharpest and most creative brains in our field to leave our society in better shape for the next generation.

title: Partner Engineer I, Car Experience
description:
Delivering the best Spotify experience possible. To as many people as possible. In as many moments as possible. That’s what the Experience team is all about. We use our deep understanding of consumer expectations to enrich the lives of millions of our users all over the world, bringing the music and audio they love to the devices, apps and platforms they use every day. Know what our users want? Join us and help Spotify give it to them.
Location


Stockholm
Job type


Permanent  


We’re looking for a Partner Engineer to join one of our teams who own the built-in Spotify Automotive app in cars experience. In this role, you will play a crucial role in ensuring the seamless integration of Spotify into cars, delivering an exceptional music, podcast and audiobook streaming experience to millions of users worldwide. You will collaborate with partners, both internal and external, to drive integrations, resolve technical issues, and enhance the overall Spotify experience in the automotive space.
What You'll Do

* You will be the technical expert for partner integrations, including how our Android Automotive app integrates with partners’ systems, APIs and Android Automotive Operating systems. You will be seen as the “go-to” person by Spotify’s automotive partners on a day-to-day basis.
* You will take the lead in coordinating partner-specific projects and workstreams, covering all aspects of integration and delivery, including launch sign-off. Acting as the bridge between Tech, Product and Automotive, you will employ a broad approach to partner management, shaping the partner technical relationships, timelines and driving improvement initiatives.
* You assist in diagnosing and resolving partner-reported defects and incidents. Collaborate with internal engineering teams to solve and ensure timely resolution, while keeping Spotify’s external partners informed.
* You’ll be responsible for connecting partners’ and Spotify’s needs between our Collaborate with the community of Partner Engineers across Spotify to enhance standards, strategies, and frameworks, fostering continuous improvement.
* You identify dependencies, assess technical risks, and clarify uncertainties to unblock internal and external teams.
* You understand partner requirements and translate them into concrete work for engineering teams. You convey partner needs effectively, contributing to the development of innovative solutions.

Who You Are

* You are truly passionate about the industry and understand the complex technical infrastructure and the dynamics unique to it.
* Experience in software development with languages and environments such as JavaScript/Java/ PHP etc.
* You have proven ability to communicate effectively across different cultures and domains, including product, business, engineering, and design.
* You have an understanding of how distributed systems, APIs, and data pipelines work.
* You can recognize operational processes that need improvement and you proactively take initiative to enhance them.
* You are comfortable with flexible working hours to accommodate video calls in different time zones. Occasional travel may be required to visit partners.
* You have a driver’s license.

Where You'll Be

* For this role you will be based at our office in Stockholm, Sweden.

Our global benefits


Extensive learning opportunities, through our dedicated team, GreenHouse.
Flexible share incentives letting you choose how you share in our success.
Global parental leave, six months off - fully paid - for all new parents.
All The Feels, our employee assistance program and self-care hub.
Flexible public holidays, swap days off according to your values and beliefs.
Learn about life at Spotify


Spotify is an equal opportunity employer. You are welcome at Spotify for who you are, no matter where you come from, what you look like, or what’s playing in your headphones. Our platform is for everyone, and so is our workplace. The more voices we have represented and amplified in our business, the more we will all thrive, contribute, and be forward-thinking! So bring us your personal experience, your perspectives, and your background. It’s in our differences that we will find the power to keep revolutionizing the way the world listens.  

Spotify transformed music listening forever when we launched in 2008. Our mission is to unlock the potential of human creativity by giving a million creative artists the opportunity to live off their art and billions of fans the chance to enjoy and be passionate about these creators. Everything we do is driven by our love for music and podcasting. Today, we are the world’s most popular audio streaming subscription service.
company_description: Passionate music fans. Innovative tech wizards. Perfect harmony. Join our band.

title: Senior Engineering Manager - Complete SW Integration & Verification
description:
**Who We Are**
--------------

  

At Volvo Cars, we are driven by a mission to revolutionize the automotive experience and simplify people's lives. We seek world-class leaders who inspire and shape this vision. Within the Complete Software Integration & Release (CSIR) team, we focus on designing rigs, integrating base technologies, core system applications, and software domains to deliver comprehensive software and electronic solutions. Our team is dedicated to maximizing test value through continuous integration, managing the complete baseline, and growing the software factory community. As part of the Integration, Verification, and Orchestration team, you will play a critical role in leveraging test value across engineering to deliver groundbreaking solutions.

  


**What you'll do**
------------------

  

As the Senior Engineering Manager for Complete Software Integration & Verification (CSIV), you will lead a section within CSIR responsible for building confidence in the master branch through non-functional and inter-functional testing at the complete integration level. Your goal will be to ensure an always-releasable master branch. Leading the CSIV section, you will oversee an organization of over 100 individuals, directly managing several Engineering Managers, a Program Manager (PM), a Release Train Engineer (RTE), and a System Architect.


You will be an integral member of the CSIR leadership team, collaborating closely with three other sections: Software Factory, Complete Software Operations, and Engineering Test & Integration Strategy. Your work will also involve tight collaboration with software development units across Engineering, the Software Test Center, and Complete Vehicle Validation to drive seamless integration and testing processes.

  


**Who You Are**
---------------

  

To excel in this role, you bring extensive experience in continuous integration, test automation, and integration-driven development. You have a strong track record of leading through leaders and fostering high-performing teams. You possess excellent communication and collaboration skills, combined with analytical and structured problem-solving abilities. Personally, you embody courage, energy, integrity, professionalism, and holistic thinking.


You hold a Master’s degree in Electrical or Software Engineering (or equivalent experience) and have at least 10 years of experience in software testing, integration, and program management. Experience with agile frameworks and exposure to the automotive industry are highly beneficial for this role.

title: Embedded Software Integration

title: E/E Validation Analyst
description:
**Company Description**  

Join the world of the future in a fast growing international company!


At SEGULA Technologies you will have the opportunity to work on exciting projects and help shaping the future within an engineering company which is at the heart of innovation. From 3D printing, augmented reality, connected vehicle to the factory of the future – new technologies are part of our 13,000 ingenious collaborators’ day-to-day life. Would you like to join in?


Whether you are a student, young graduate, engineer or experienced project manager, at SEGULA Technologies you will find the opportunity to give a new meaning to your career. Skills development is a big part of SEGULA Technologies’ DNA, the company offers the possibility to move between sectors and positions, as well as attractive geographic mobility opportunities.


SEGULA Technologies is always looking for new, ingenious, and daring talents worldwide to support all the major industrial actors within the automotive, aeronautics, energy, railway, naval, oil & gas and pharmaceutical sectors.


Do you have a touch of genius? Take a new challenge and join us!


For more information: https://www.segulatechnologies.com

 **Job Description**  

* Responsible for development & delivery of electrical, mechanical & diagnostic trainings. This includes but is not limited to CAN-Bus communication, Kibes architecture, Engine ECU protocol, Transmission ECU protocol, ADAS Functionality and Vehicle Body Controller.Modeling physics of EE components, validation of electronic and electrotechnical sizing of systems
* Management of diagnostic data and detailed documentation for the Diagnostic data for BMS ( Battery Management System ) Diagnostic Functinoalities
* Participate in the realization of the validation plan for the vehicle
* Maintain contact with all actors involved in vehicle testing/validation
* Analysis of the data taken after the testing
* Validation of wiring and related parts
* Validation of digital and analog electronic systems: measurements and conduct of tests
* Validation of software on PIE
* Open to work travel frequently in Europe

  

**Qualifications**  

* Completed engineering studies (bachelor's or master's degree) of electrical & electronics.
* Electrical Distribution Systems Engineering for Commercial Vehicles (BEV-BUS/ Truck), Circuit Design, Component Selection.
* HV Power Strategy Harness Verification by hands-on continuity check, CAN, LIN connection, and voltage control on wiring harness, communication protocols.
* Knowledge of vehicle diagnostic and analysis tools such as CAN/CANalyzer.
* Connection between HV and LV equipment by vehicle architecture. Decision of LV battery components
* Preferably knowledge of engineering tools i.e. INDIGO, DiagRA, CANoe, Candela, vSignalyzer, CANalyzer
* Preferably certification about handling “High Voltage Systems” on field. (Annual safety training for qualified electricians (EFK)
* Fault Management Interface (FMI) for SPN/Fault Diagnostic concepts in Vehicle
* Excellent analytical skills
* Excellent verbal, presentation and written communication skills in English
* Expert level Microsoft Office package. (Excel, PowerPoint, Word, Outlook).
* Problem-solving skills
* Familiar with core engineering processes such as FMEA.

  

**Additional Information**  

Our benefits are:

* Glasses compensation;
* Meal tickets;
* Gift tickets;
* Life and Health Insurance;
* Medical subscription to a private clinic;
* Partnership with a dental clinic;
* Discounts on tickets to festivals;
* Christmas party;
* An environment favourable to the development of autonomy;
* Opportunities for growth;
* Bonuses from referrals;
* French and English courses;
* Business trip expenses covered.

title: Rekryterare
description:
Urval sker löpande Lund Arbete på plats
  
  

Är du redo att ta dig an rekrytering i högt tempo på ett tillväxtbolag? Yaay – då är vi teamet för dig!
  
  

I People & Culture-teamet på Lime stöttar vi och hjälper varandra. Vi driver bland annat Limes traineeprogram och ser till att alla rekryteringar på Lime blir tillsatta, både i Sverige och utomlands - en extra rolig utmaning!
  
  

Under de sista tre åren har vi rekryterat mellan 75-110 personer per år. Vi är riktigt stolta över vårt rekryteringsarbete och vår process. Du kommer göra både juniora och seniora rekryteringar och arbeta med annonsering och aktiv search. Teamet består idag av totalt 6 personer, både Office Mood Managers och rekryterare, och nu letar vi alltså efter nästa helt underbara person som vill utmana oss att bli ännu bättre och göra riktigt bra rekryteringar. Förutom rekrytering kommer du ha ett ansvarsområde inom employer branding. Du kommer att planera och genomföra mässor och events, både i Sverige och utomlands.
  
  

**Exempel på arbetsuppgifter du kommer arbeta med:**  

Rekrytering till alla våra personalgrupper, utvecklare, säljare, projektledare, applikationskonsulter och till alla typer av stödfunktioner inom Lime. Mest sannolikt kommer du bli expert på några av dessa grupper och inrikta dig på dem.
  
**Mässor och event:** strategi – vart vårt deltagande gör mest nytta och uppfyller våra syften och mål om att till exempel attrahera fler kvinnor till tech. Rent operativt planerar du, förbereder och tillsammans med kollegor genomför dessa event.
  
**Kulturskapande aktiviteter:** vi fixar fester, tävlingar, events etc.
  
**Personaladministration:** såsom exempelvis on- och offboarding och exitintervjuer.
  
**Koordinering:** vi slussar kandidaten genom processen på ett trevligt och professionellt sätt, men stöttar också alla kollegor som är delaktiga i rekryteringsprocessen.
  
Några av våra medarbetare
  
Anna-Mari Ewing
  
Sales Operations Specialist
  
"Om du ger uttryck för dina ambitioner och vad du behöver för stöd, så finns det stora möjligheter att utveckla din karriär med oss."
  
Matilda Alm
  
Account Manager
  
"På Lime trivs jag med fantastiska kollegor och en inspirerande kultur. Möjligheterna att utmanas och växa som säljare gör varje dag spännande och unik."
  
Terry Ilebode
  
Software Engineer
  
"Lime ger mig ett holistiskt stöd i alla delar av mitt liv genom att både utmana mig som mjukvaruutvecklare och ge mig stöd i min personliga utveckling."
  
Henrik Kjærvik
  
Head of Expert Services
  
"Det bästa med att jobba på Lime, förutom kollegorna så klart, är flexibiliteten och möjligheterna att utveckla din karriär i linje med dina egna mål och ambitioner."
  
Kvalifikationer
  
  

Ok, du förstår säkert redan att det här är ett toppenjobb, och visst, det finns också vissa förväntningar på dig:
  
  

Du har avslutat din fil kand på programmet för personal- och arbetslivsfrågor, och hunnit arbeta med rekrytering i något eller några år. Vi ser gärna att du har arbetat med aktiv search. Vi blir superglada om du hunnit arbeta med employer branding – skriv gärna och berätta om det i så fall. Det är självklart att du talar och skriver engelska obehindrat - vårt koncernspråk är engelska. Talar du andra språk? Kul - berätta gärna det för oss!
  
  

Det är en relativt junior roll – men missta dig inte. Vi letar efter en stjärna som är beredd att rulla upp ärmarna och som vill växa tillsammans med oss.
  
  

För att passa in vårt team och på Lime krävs att du gillar att lära dig nya saker. Du gillar högt tempo och när det händer nya saker som kan få dig att tänka om eller byta taktik för att nå framgång. Du tar dig an uppgifter på ett optimistiskt sätt och söker dig gärna själv fram till svar. Du skapar härlig stämning omkring dig och bjuder gärna på dig själv. Som alltid inom HR krävs att du har hög integritet och kan hålla huvudet kallt.
  
  

Vi ser fram emot din ansökan!
  
  

Konferenser och sociala aktiviteter
  
  

Träning och utveckling
  
  

Balans i (jobb)livet
  
  

Kaffe, dricka och fika
  
  

Hälsa och välmående
  
  

Bygga Lime tillsammans
  
  

Om företaget
  
  

Lime är ett börsnoterat techbolag med 9 kontor i 6 länder. Vi växer konstant med ca 20 % per år och öppnade under hösten 2020 vårt första utomnordiska kontor i Nederländerna. Sedan dess har vi äntrat Tyskland och har ständigt ögonen öppna för nya, potentiella marknader. Men det där är bara siffror och fakta. Det riktigt härliga med Lime är vi som jobbar här - ett stort gäng omtänksamma, ambitiösa kollegor som kämpar för en värld där alla kundupplevelser överträffar förväntningarna. Med hjälp av smart teknik och träffsäker expertis förenklar vi kunders vardag och skapar förutsättningar för det där lilla extra. Något som fortfarande är unikt för ett mjukvarubolag som Lime är också att vi sköter hela produktlivscykeln själva - allt från utveckling, till leverans, till support. Vi tar helt enkelt ansvar för att kedjan är hel och välfungerande, med en twist. Vi kallar det #dontbreakthechain.
  
  

Lime grundades av tre studenter i Lund år 1990
  
  

Lime klimatkompenserar genom grön el från en solcellspark utanför Sjöbo
  
  

Lime har gjort sex företagsförvärv sedan år 2017
  
  

Limes nuvarande VD Nils började som en av de första traineerna år 2006
  
  

Lime introducerades på Nasdaq i Stockholm år 2018
  
  

Lime lanserade sitt omvända mentorskapsprogram år 2019
  
  

Limes mjukvara har en räckvidd på ca 100 miljoner människor dagligen
  
  

Pernilla Möller | Kontaktperson
company_description: Looking for a boring employer? Look elsewhere! At Lime, we love customer care, sales and case management! We love to deliver that “something special” – while having a lot of fun along the way.

title: Senior Mechatronics Engineer - Brake system HW Team
description:
**Do you share our devotion to safety?**
**For nearly a century, Volvo Cars has been a symbol of automotive safety, committed to protecting our world and the people in it. Now, we're paving the way toward a future where collisions belong to the past. And it's not just about technology; it's about our devotion to safety and our promise to make the world a safer place. So if you feel strongly about creating a safer world, join us in shaping a collision-free tomorrow.**
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

  


**Braking system HW Team – Let’s introduce ourselves!**
-------------------------------------------------------

The responsibility of the team is to define and deliver the braking systems for future vehicle programs focusing on new electro-hydraulic or electro-mechanical brake actuation/modulation by-wire systems. As leader in innovation and safety, Volvo Cars is committed to continuously work finding technologies that can define new safety standards and braking systems is one of the key areas of development to set them.


**What you will do**
--------------------



As a Senior Mechatronics Engineer in the Braking system HW team, you will lead and contribute to the design and implementation of new braking systems.


Your primary responsibilities include designing, testing, and implementing solutions that meet performance, safety, and regulatory requirements. You will define & balance requirements with all the internal and external stakeholders from the concept phase until the start of production. You will collaborate with cross-functional teams, including engineers, designers, and project managers, to conceptualize and deliver high-quality products within specified timelines.

  


You will:


* Lead efforts to implement new brake modulation systems, balancing performance, manufacturability, cost and requirements
* Review technical specifications and /or detailed 2D and 3D models to ensure accuracy and compliance with design specifications
* Analyze performance and durability, optimize designs and translate vehicle requirements into supplier specifications
* Oversee prototyping and testing to validate designs against defined requirements
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams and suppliers to integrate components and resolve design issues
* Prepare design documentation, including drawings, specifications, test plans and reports
* Identify opportunities for innovation and contribute to design reviews and knowledge sharing
* Lead or support project planning, resource allocation, and risk management to meet milestones
**What you will bring**
-----------------------



To thrive in this role, you need excellent problem-solving skills and the ability to work effectively in a fast-paced, team-oriented environment, along with strong communication skills to convey technical concepts to diverse stakeholders.  

  

We are looking for someone with:


* Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Mechatronics Engineering, Automotive Engineering or a related field
* Proven experience in chassis systems (braking, steering and wheel suspension) design and development, preferably within a Tier 1 supplier or automotive OEM
* Proficiency in model-based design tools (e.g. Matlab, Simulink, Simscape, Amesim) to design the product and evaluate test results
* Familiarity with project management principles and tools

  




And it’s a bonus if you have:


* Proficiency in CAD software (e.g., CATIA, NX) for design and analysis
* Experience within system/vehicle testing
* Experience within Software/function development within Chassis systems

  




**Ready to Take the Next Step?**
**Please submit your application through our career page. Due to GDPR regulations, we’re unable to store or consider applications from other platforms. Make sure to submit your application in English.**
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

  

  

Once your application is successfully submitted, you’ll receive a confirmation email. Applications are open until 5th of December. We’re excited to get to know you!

  



**Volvo Cars – driving change together**
**Volvo Cars’ success is the result of a collaborative, diverse and inclusive working environment. Today, we’re one of the most well-known and respected car brands, with around 43,000 employees across the globe. At Volvo Cars, your career is designed around your skills and aspirations, so you can reach your fullest potential.**

**And it’s so exciting – we’re well on our way on our journey towards full electrification. We have five fully electric cars already on the market, and five more on the way. Our fully-electric and plug-in hybrid cars combined make up almost 50 per cent of our sales. So come and join us in shaping the future of mobility. There’s never been a more rewarding time to play your part in our inspiring and creative teams!**
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------


Curious about Life at Volvo Cars? Read more


Curious about our story? Read more

title: SENIOR SYSTEM DESIGN ENGINEER GOTHENBURG, SWEDEN
description:
#### **Passionate about Engineering - RDT Engineers**


At RDT Engineers, our primary focus is our PEOPLE. We support our employees in professional and individual development. With our flat hierarchy, commitment and values, which inspire them to do their best. We pursue our PEOPLE’s work satisfaction and can guarantee highest quality, which leads to our second mission – our CLIENTS. We, our PEOPLE, provide engineering solutions that enable our customers to have a competitive advantage in efficiency, flexibility and costs.


Thanks to our PEOPLE, we have supplied the best engineering services since 2007 and offer the best and most flexible terms in the market for engineering services.


Be part of our missions and join RDT Engineers in Denmark.

  

  

  

### **SENIOR SYSTEM DESIGN ENGINEER**

  


  

We are looking for a System Design Engineer to join the team within the automotive industry in Gothenburg. The team is responsible for developing Core System Platform apps for different functions such as, optimization of energy and power usage in the car. The responsibility spans from early concept to industrialization and follow-up in the field. The team is cross-functional and responsible for system design, system safety, SW development and verification.

  

They are dedicated to building cross-functional and empowered teams and an agile environment where they learn every day, challenge each other and give continuous feedback.

  

Location: Gothenburg, onsite required 3-4 days pr. week

  

  

  

##### **AREA OF RESPONSIBILITY**


* Focus will be within system design and function specification
* Be part of writing system documentation, requirement management, review and sign-off technical documentation
* Work in close collaboration with other competences and contribute to each other within the areas of software-, system- and hardware engineering
* Lead the development of the concept solution, which means a strategy and structure to balance energy consumption for the complete electrical system during all phases of life
* Monitor implementations in ongoing car programs to secure feedback to the concept solution
* Work in close collaboration with a broad spectrum of competences within HW, SW and System engineering – expanding your knowledge within many different fields
##### **QUALIFICATIONS & COMPETENCIES**


* Have a BSc degree or higher in Software- or/and Electrical Engineering, or equivalent experience
* Experience from working in the automotive or telecom industry is a clear advantage
* +5 years of system design
* Strong communication skills
* EU driver license B
* Good to have experience/knowledge about: Elektra, CarWeaver/SystemWeaver, Testing, Automotive bus communication protocols e.g. CAN, Flexray, Ethernet, SOME/IP, experience in power electronics
* A result-oriented individual with problem solving focus and good ability to adapt to constant changes
* Self-driven individual, someone who is positive and analytical
* Able to present the results in a structured and understandable way and take the ownership for the product
* Professional level of English - both oral and written
Valid EU work permit making you able to start right away  
* 
  

  

##### **INTERESTED?**


If you are interested in / or have questions about the position, please contact us on:


denmark@rdtengineers.com
 (+45) 22315183
The position will be closed when we have found the right candidate, and we encourage you to apply as soon as possible. Notice only your CV in English is necessary.


##### **LOCATION**


Gothenburg, Sweden  

  

  

##### **START DATE**


ASAP

title: Verification Engineer
description:
**Electronics Verification Engineer**

 **Would you like to work in an international environment where you’ll make a difference every day? At Permobil, we’re looking for game-changers to join us as we innovate for individuals and develop the world’s most advanced assistive solutions.**  

  

At Permobil, the people who use our products come first. Our purpose is to create advanced assistive solutions that make the lives of adults and children living with disabilities more enriching. Our people are passionate about pushing the boundaries of technology to deliver innovations that improve lives. We are a sustainable and responsible business committed to continuous improvement, and our customers can trust us to provide market-leading solutions driven by insights-based clinical data.  

  

**Position Overview**  

  

We are seeking a **dedicated Electronics Verification Engineer to join our R&D department.** Would you like to work in an international environment for a growing company that is a leader in advanced rehab technology?  

  

This role involves verifying electronics, embedded software, and connectivity solutions used on power wheelchairs. You will also be responsible for creating parameter sets for firmware configuration of powered wheelchairs.  

  

**Key Responsibilities**

* Verify electronic and embedded software solutions.
* Create parameter sets for firmware used in powered wheelchairs.
* Develop and maintain automatic test systems.
* Analyze reported deviations from end-users.
* Participate in the entire lifecycle of our products.
* Contribute to the development and improvement of our processes and methods.

Adhere to company policies, rules, processes, and guidelines.  
* **Who you are**  

We envision you as a problem solver with a strong innovative mind and great collaborative skills. You have a strong ability to see the bigger picture and actively participate in all aspects of the work as well as being thorough, flexible, a good listener, and precise in your work. You want to be part of a highly skilled team that collectively strives for the most innovative solutions, and every day, engage in meaningful work where you contribute to making a difference for people around the world.  

  

**Qualifications:**
* Bachelor’s degree in relevant fields or equivalent experience in verification and/or design of embedded solutions.
* Proficiency in automated test systems, verification strategies, Linux, and connectivity.
* Familiarity with electronics architectures and ability to create prototypes and test tools.
* Ability to follow rules and regulations and collaborate across departments.

Excellent communication skills in English (minimum C1 level) and Swedish.  
* **Meritorious:**
* Experience from working with Jira, Jenkins, Hive etc.

Understanding of the design, development, and manufacturing of electronic solutions.  
* **Why Permobil is a great next step for you!**  

*1. You’ll make a difference. Every day*  

Everything we do leads to understanding and improving the lives of our users. Through our evidence-based innovation, we make a difference to people’s lives.  

  

*2. You’ll make your mark as part of our future*  

We collaborate with colleagues across borders to Innovate for Individuals. The impact you make personally could lead change around the world.  

  

*3. You’ll feel welcome from day one*  

We’re known for being great colleagues, who are collaborative, fun and at the cutting-edge. Everyone in the Permobil family cares as much as you do about making a positive difference.  

  

*4. You can have a lifestyle you love*  

This position is located at our brand new office in Sundsvall. In Sundsvall you’re always close to nature, yet never far from civilization. We want everyone who works for us to have a lifestyle they love – at work and beyond.  

  

**Information**  

Please apply via our career page no later than **December 15th.** We will conduct selection continuously so send us your application today!  

  

For additional information about the position, please contact *Manager Electronics, Johan Wängdahl, johan.wangdahl@permobil.com*  

For information about the recruitment process, please contact the *recruiter, Kristin Berglund Goode, kristin.berglundgoode@permobil.com*  

  

*For information regarding Permobil's Privacy Notice, please visit privacy.permobil.com*  

  

*At Permobil, diversity fuels our innovation in creating life-changing mobility solutions. We embrace the unique talents and perspectives of individuals from all backgrounds to drive our mission forward. Join Permobil and be part of a team where diversity is not just valued, but essential to our success in delivering personalized mobility solutions.*  

  

Please respect that we do not wish recruitment assistance or advertising, we decline calls from recruitment and advertising providers.  

  

**More about Permobil**  

Permobil founder Dr. Per Uddén believed that helping people achieve the greatest level of independence is a basic human right and, for over 50 years, Permobil has held fast to that belief. Permobil is a global leader in advanced rehabilitation technology, passionate about better understanding our users’ needs and improving their quality of life through state-of-the-art healthcare solutions. Today, those solutions include power wheelchairs, seating and positioning products, power assist, and manual wheelchairs.  

Permobil is part of Patricia Industries, a subsidiary of Investor AB, and is headquartered in Sweden. Permobil has 1900 team members in more than 18 countries around the world. For more information regarding the company’s storied history and complete product line, visit permobil.com.

title: Mechanical Design Engineer
description:
**A Snapshot of Your Day**


We are looking for a designer for our pipe installation department in order engineering!


In your daily work, you will work with pipe design for the auxiliary systems of our gas turbines. You work in project teams to find solutions to technical challenges and meet our customers' expectations around the world. You take full responsibility for your solution from design to installation by using tools such as the CAD tool NX and Teamcenter.

 **How you will make an impact**

* Act as the responsible mechanical engineer in assigned order projects, ensuring all designs are meticulously crafted to meet customer specifications and requirements.
* Develop and implement innovative solutions, taking ownership of tasks from start to finish.
* Provide support to home assembly, site operations, and subcontractors with expertise on design and installation.
* Be a great teammate, embracing a collaborative spirit across different interfaces.
* Show a track record of effectively organizing and prioritizing work to achieve project achievements.

 **What you bring**


We believe that you are characterized by being thorough, structured, and thrives in a collaborative environment. You are quality-conscious with the ability to prioritize effectively within project timelines. Excellent communication and interpersonal skills are essential, as you will be building partnerships both internally and externally. Being adaptable and open to diverse cultures and perspectives is a must. Proficiency in English, both spoken and written, is required as it is our corporate language.

* A degree in Engineering, MSc or BSc, or equivalent experience.
* Proven expertise in mechanical design, preferably in pipe design and knowledge about Pressure Equipment Directive.
* Familiarity with gas turbines and their auxiliary systems is an advantage
* Proficiency in CAD software, preferably NX.

 **About the Team**


Join our dynamic team of about 20 engineers from different parts of the world, each brining their own distinct backgrounds and experiences. Our team thrives on collaboration, allowing us to collectively tackle technical challenges and achieve our ambitious objectives!


Our **Gas Services** division offers Low-emission power generation through service and decarbonization. Zero or low emission power generation and all gas turbines under one roof, steam turbines and generators. Decarbonization opportunities through service offerings, modernization, and digitalization of the fleet.


We can offer you employment benefits such as: reduction of working hours, advance vacation, health care allowance and the possibility of a hybrid workplace.

 **Who is Siemens Energy?**


At Siemens Energy, we are more than just an energy technology company. We meet the growing energy demand across 90+ countries while ensuring our climate is protected. With more than 98,000 dedicated employees, we not only generate electricity for over 16% of the global community, but we’re also using our technology to help protect people and the environment.


Our global team is committed to making sustainable, reliable, and affordable energy a reality by pushing the boundaries of what is possible. We uphold a 150-year legacy of innovation that encourages our search for people who will support our focus on decarbonization, new technologies, and energy transformation.


Find out how you can make a difference at Siemens Energy: https://www.siemens-energy.com/employeevideo

 **Our Commitment to Diversity**


Lucky for us, we are not all the same. Through diversity, we generate power. We run on inclusion and our combined creative energy is fueled by over 130 nationalities. Siemens Energy celebrates character – no matter what ethnic background, gender, age, religion, identity, or disability. We energize society, all of society, and we do not discriminate based on our differences.

 **Application**


Don’t hesitate – apply already today, but not later than 2024-12-08.


Ongoing selection is applied, the role might be filled before last application date.

  

For questions about the role, please contact the recruiting manager Liselotte Engdahl on liselotte.engdahl@siemens-energy.com


For questions about the recruitment process please contact the responsible recruiter Ellen Johansson on ellen.johansson@siemens-energy.com

  

We refrain from all contact with staffing and recruitment companies, or advertising brokers.


Location: Finspång

Anders Häll, Unionen, +46122-887514


Simon Von Eckardstein, Sveriges Ingenjörer, +46122-842 24


Jan Lundgren, Ledarna, +46122-812 33


Mikael Malmgren, IF Metall, +4676-6958685

title: Validation Engineer Software/Hardware
description:
CTEK is a global market leader in vehicle charging solutions.
  
CTEK is the leading global brand in battery charging solutions, most specifically vehicle charging. CTEK offers products ranging from 12V & 24V battery chargers to charging solutions for electrical vehicles. Products are sold via a carefully selected network of global distributors and retailers, as original equipment, supplied to more than 50 of the world’s leading vehicle manufacturers and through charge point operators, property owners as well as other organizations and individuals providing EV charging infrastructure.
  
We are now hiring aValidation Engineer Software/Hardware based in Norrköping.
  
  

**What you do:**  

As a Validation Engineer Software/Hardware at CTEK, you will validate software and hardware designs, ensuring compliance with specifications and regulatory standards. You’ll collaborate with R&D teams, drive validation processes, and support continuous improvement through feedback and troubleshooting.
  
Reviewing and validating product designs in both hardware and software, ensuring adherence to specifications and regulatory/legal requirements.
  
Executing validation work within CTEK’s projects, including system-level validation of electronics and embedded systems.
  
Providing feedback and test results to R&D teams, offering support on questions, issues, and specifications as they arise.
  
Maintaining and developing the validation process to improve efficiency and ensure high standards.
  
Collaborating closely with various internal teams to ensure smooth project execution and high-quality product outcomes.
  
  

**Who you are:**  

You are a proactive and detail-oriented engineer with a strong background in validating both software and hardware components. You thrive in collaborative environments and enjoy problem-solving, especially when it comes to identifying and resolving issues at the intersection of software and hardware. You are skilled in both the technical and communication aspects of the role and are committed to ensuring products meet the highest standards of performance, reliability, and compliance. A team player who actively contributes to the success of projects and works well within multidisciplinary teams.
  
  

**Your skills:**  

A strong understanding of electronics at a system level, and you are familiar with embedded systems and related testing techniques.
  
Multi-year experience in validation and testing of both software and hardware components, with a focus on ensuring compliance with specifications and regulatory requirements, ideally in product development environments with embedded systems and electronics.
  
Skilled in communicating complex technical information clearly and effectively, both verbally and in writing. You are also proficient in creating detailed validation documentation.
  
A strong understanding of troubleshooting techniques, particularly in how software and hardware interact, and you can identify and resolve issues in cross-disciplinary environments.
  
A university degree in Engineering, Electronics, or equivalent.
  
Fluent in English, verbally and written.
  
  

Why CTEK?
  
At CTEK, we believe in fostering innovation and continuous improvement. You’ll be joining a dynamic, collaborative environment where your expertise will directly contribute to the development of cutting-edge products that power the future of energy and technology.
  
Ready to contribute your skills and make a real impact? Apply no later than December 15th

title: Documentation Engineer
description:
Scope of the assignment
  
Support the ESS project organisation, NSS, with preparing necessary documentation:
  
Use CHESS (ESS document management tool) as it pertains to meet the quality requirements on documents and assist NSS Detector project in the use of the tool. This includes: create new document
  
create new revision of existing document,
  
find/use appropriate template
  
assign reviewers
  
describe purpose of review
  
help identify review scope necessary
  
start review process
  
  

Proof-read and edit technical documents in English - fix formatting errors, language errors.
  
Help document owners fix existing documents with known errors and bring them into alignment with quality requirements for ESS documentation.
  
Structure the documentation by linking documents to the ESS wide facility breakdown structure.
  
Determine, based on ESS guidelines, where documentation needs to be complemented or updated.
  
  

**Assignment may also include:**  

Manage content of Confluence page (website)
  
Manage Jira (issue tracking project management tool) tasks
  
  

**Required Qualifications:**  

Bachelor in technical field (ex. engineering, physics, safety, chemistry) or an equivalent combination of education and experience.
  
Knowledge of common Elmech (Mechatronic) engineering standards and practices will be considered an asset
  
Experience in document management.
  
Experience writing, proof-reading and editing of technical documentation; experience with documentation in English.
  
Proficiency in graphic design software for creating illustrations will be considered an asset.
  
Ability to communicate well with individuals in technical fields including engineering, science, safety, instrumentation and control, information technology.
  
Excellent written and oral skills in English.
  
  

**Personal profile:**  

Strong problem solving, analytical methods and technical skills.
  
Ability to work effectively in and with team(s).
  
Uses initiative to identify and resolve problems/issues and has good judgement.
  
Communication - ability to establish and maintain good communication with stakeholders, comfortable communicating with individuals of varying technical backgrounds, ability to compile information in an organized manner and communicate through written media.
  
Demonstrated ability to work independently and as part of a group.
  
Adaptability - flexible approach and ability to cope with changing demands and priorities, willing to learn new skills.
  
Organizational skills - demonstrated ability to plan and organize your work to meet schedule and performance requirements.
  
Patience - comfortable with repetitive tasks that require attention to detail.

title: Senior Calibration Engineer - Vehicle Motion Control
emails: christoffer.nylen@aurobay.com, clara.pryde@aurobay.com, joakim.dahlin@aurobay.com, hakan.modigh@aurobay.com, fredrik.fantenberg@aurobay.com, marko.borg.peltonen@aurobay.com
description:
Aurobay develops and produces world-class hybrid engines and transmissions. With factories on two continents - Sweden and China - we're a pioneering global supplier of propulsion technology, development services and contract manufacturing. The Aurobay brand brings together over 9,000 dedicated and determined people that design, develop, and manufacture next-generation powertrain solutions for a global market.
  
Aurobay is part of HORSE Powertrain Limited, a global leader in powertrain solutions. The Group has 19,000 employees, 17 plants and 5 R&D centers across three continents. We partner with OEM customers around the world and offer innovative solutions that can cater to up to 80% of the growing hybrid and combustion powertrain market, enabling a faster transition toward cleaner mobility.
  
As a Senior Calibration Engineer at Aurobay you will conduct cutting-edge and innovative research and development to advance our technology and capabilities reaching our sustainability goal of net zero.
  
What we offer
  
In addition to a competitive salary, a great location on Lindholmen or Skövde, and a genuine work-life balance, we provide the following benefits:
  
A yearly wellness contribution of SEK 5 000 for your physical and mental wellbeing.
  
A personal and professional development scheme to support your growth.
  
Additional pension funding.
  
Competitive additional and full coverage insurance.
  
  

Skills and Experience
  
Bachelor, Master’s in mechanical, Physics, Chemist or Electrical Engineering, or equivalent, with a passion for cars and internal combustion engines.
  
Deep experience in calibration of ICE/Hybrid parameters to achieve attribute targets
  
Good communication and status reporting skills
  
A feeling for Cost, Quality and Time
  
Valid passenger car driving license issued in a European country
  
  

Your role at Aurobay As a Senior Calibration Engineer you will:
  
Optimize the behavior of the powertrain and vehicle control in order to fulfill the performance, emissions and drivability attributes.
  
Update and develop new functions to our in house application software.
  
Work in a project driven organization.
  
Perform tests in test cells and in vehicles.
  
Make test plans according to the project timing and gates.
  
  

Equal opportunities employer
  
We are an equal opportunities employer. We encourage candidates from underrepresented groups to apply, especially women, people from ethnic minority backgrounds, and people with disabilities. Research has shown that women and people from ethnic minority backgrounds are less likely to apply if they don't match 100% of the criteria. As a company, we value diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment. If you believe you have the skills and passion to excel in this role, we would love to hear from you. Let's explore the possibilities together.
  
How to apply
  
Deadline to submit your application is 8 december but the selection process will be running continuously. Please note that due to GDPR, we do not accept applications via email. We can’t wait to see what you can bring to our team!
  
Questions
  
If you have any additional questions regarding the position, you are welcome to contact recruiting manager Christoffer Nylén, christoffer.nylen@aurobay.com
  
For questions regarding the recruitment process please contact Recruiter Clara Pryde, clara.pryde@aurobay.com

title: Embedded Tester
description:
About the job
  
As a Test Engineer you will build and integrate HIL test environments for different testing needs and create advanced tests that saves time and cost for development. You will participate in the early stages of the product lifecycle to define needs in test systems. You will be working on the complete software and electrical integration. This means that you will establish and develop relationsships with designers and other test engineers within different systems and areas of the complete vehicle as well as building a understanding of the designs within those areas. The testing will take place in rigs, boxcars and VIL (Vehicle In the Loop).
  
  

**Some of your main tasks will be to:**  

Troubleshoot environment and products to determine possible area of the problem
  
Build and integrate test solution with other parts to make an automated toolchain
  
Analyze product requirements to create test cases
  
  

Who are you?
  
You need to be a person who thrives to take responsibility for the product quality, knows what you want, and are transparent, flexible and curious. We see that you are motivated by new challenges and experiences and thrive in problemsolving.
  
The job will require fluency in English, Swedish is a merit.
  
Qualifications
  
Bachelors degree, Master's degree or equivalent in relevant field
  
Knowledge of Python
  
Experience with Matlab/Simulink
  
Experience with Vector Canalyzer, CANoe and/or DSPACE, Wireshark
  
Experience of working with software testing automation frameworks, Robot Framework
  
Fluent in English (written and spoken)
  
Valid working permit in Sweden
  
  

**Meritious:**  

Knowledge of C, C++
  
Experience with CI/CD
  
Experience working with automotive diagnostics and communication protocols such as CAN, LIN, Ethernet
  
Drivers licence is highly meritious
  
Swedish language skills are highly meritious

title: Senior QA Engineer
description:
About Brite
  
Brite Payments is a leading Open Banking-powered Account to Account (A2A) payment provider of Instant Payments and Instant Payouts. We provide a convenient transaction experience for consumers and reduce the risk in the payment process for merchants. Founded in Stockholm in 2019, Brite is committed to providing the best possible payment solution for everyone involved in a transaction.The team behind Brite has worked with launching the first-generation of fintech companies before founding Brite. We know the market landscape, technologies, opportunities, and challenges. Now we channel all those experiences into developing modern solutions that will benefit both merchants and end-users.Want to join us on our journey? The future is Brite!
  
What you will do
  
At Brite you will be part of our highly skilled QA team where we take accountability for the QA and Test strategy, toolset, and processes. We also work across the Engineering teams to support them in their quality and test work as well as assisting them with deploying high quality solutions.Your responsibilities will include
  
Work on a daily basis with the QA and Test domains at the company. Together with your fellow QA team mates you take accountability for our QA and Test Strategies, the test management and the testing tools and frameworks we need to deliver quality products.
  
Supporting one or multiple Engineering teams as they mature in writing and executing tests and other quality verification tools. Your focus is on improving how the team works.
  
In this senior role you are also expected to be a mentor for other QA engineers as they grow their skill sets over time.
  
Reporting and Monitoring tools are a vital part of improving our work, both in engineering and in QA. You are going to share responsibility with other engineers in improving our tools.
  
  

With that said, you will be a vital part of the next fintech unicorn!
  
Are you a brite mind?
  
You are a leader with a solid technical background in modern development. You have experience from managing or facilitating technical collaborations between teams and departments. In the past you have had formal leadership roles such as Tech Lead, Development Manager or as an Architect. You have experience collaborating in creating Architectural visions and how to communicate them to the relevant stakeholders. You are a developer at heart! The ideal candidate has:
  
Experience in Test Automation and manual software testing.
  
Experience from working in a micro service architecture
  
Knowledge of Quality Assurance principles, methods and techniques
  
5+ year of professional work experience
  
Having mentored other QA engineers, for example in a formal or informal leadership role.
  
  

**Good to have experience:**  

Experience with Selenium, Cypress or any other relevant modern automation tool
  
Experience with Postman, Charles
  
Experience with Javascript/Typescript, Python
  
Knowledge of Gherkin or another BDD tool.
  
  

What we offer
  
An optimistic, caring, and inclusive culture where we want you to be yourself
  
A dynamic, fast-paced, and innovative environment where you will have the possibility to make an impact from your first day onwards
  
A flat organization, friendly colleagues, and fast decision-making
  
An environment where we start small and learn fast to do big things
  
A team that cares about sharing, collaborative work, and prestigelessness
  
... and you will be part of a growing team of fun and skilled people
  
  

Do you want to learn more about our recruitment process? Here you can read about the hiring flow and find answers to the most frequently asked questions.
  
\*\*\*
  
Please apply with your CV or your LinkedIn profile. We use screening questions to streamline this recruitment process, so a personal letter is not needed.

title: Junior Application Engineer
description:
Cambio is one of the Nordics' leading suppliers in e-health with a comprehensive offering for the entire health and care chain. Our e-health solutions support healthcare professionals in their daily work and offer patients safer and more easily accessible care. We are proud to be an important part of Swedish health and social care. We are growing continuously and now have about 1000 employees in several countries.
  
The positionAs a JuniorApplication Engineer at Cambio, you will be apart of something bigger, and your contribution will bring direct benefits and value to both healthcare professionals and yourself as a patient. Our products demand high standards of availability, performance, and patient safety.
  
You will be part of our competent Application Management team, which acts as the link between our customers - Sweden's regions and county councils - and our development department. Initially, your role will involve being part of the team responsible for third-line technical support, which includes troubleshooting Java applications, SQL databases, networks, and other infrastructure.
  
As a Junior Application Engineer, you will work with technical solutions used in large installations with thousands of concurrent users, where scalability and performance are paramount.
  
We work both independently and together in the team. We value a good team spirit and a work environment where our colleagues thrive.Working in the support line involves daily customer contact, primarily in writing via a ticketing system and sometimes via phone or video meetings.
  
We offer a workplace characterized by a lack of prestige, knowledge sharing, and a desire for constant improvement. You will be able to create, influence, and improve work methods, develop, and build customer relationships while working with the latest technology.
  
Flexible working hours are applied, and travel to our customers may occur.
  
At Cambio, we encourage taking initiatives that contribute to the development of the company and ourselves. For us, it is important that you should have the opportunity to grow, both as a person and as an employee.Our culture is described through the words “Trust”, “Care” and “Together” which permeateeverything we do.
  
About youWe are looking for someone with relevant education or work experience in the same field. Perhaps you have studied computer engineering or information systems.
  
Requirements
  
A strong interest in technology and a willingness to learn new things
  
Experience (from studies or work) in software development and/or system administration
  
Basic knowledge of at least one programming language
  
Basic understanding of relational databases
  
Great communication skills in English and Swedish
  
  

It's a bonus if you have worked with
  
Microsoft SQL Server
  
System administration in a Linux environment
  
System administration in a Windows environment
  
Java development
  
Experience with container-based solutions
  
  

**Place of employment:** Linköping
  
At Cambio we value a healthy work-life balance, and to encourage that we apply a hybrid working-model. Together with your team you decide which days you work at the office. On the remaining days you can work remotely from home, but you are always more than welcome to work at the office too.
  
**Scope:** Full time
  
**Form of employment:** Permanent employment, 6 months trial period
  
**Other:** We screen the applications and hold interviews continuously so please send your application as soon as possible via the link.
  
We encourage and eagerly welcome all applications, but we will only consider candidates who are located and have the legal right to work inSweden.We will ask for verification during the process.
  
We look forward to receiving your application!
  
Read more about ushere!
  
Are you interested in Cambio but you don’t feel that this position is the perfect match? Check out our other open positions at the career sitehere!
