title: System Engineer to OHB Sweden - Focus defense projects
description:
OHB Sweden is a leading Swedish supplier of space systems. We develop, build, test and commission satellites and subsystems for space missions in, for example, communication, earth observation and space research for institutional and commercial customers within and outside Europe.
  
  

At us you are going to be a big part of our defense projects and work withnew and challenging spacecraft and small constellation programs - commercially, nationally and with the European Space Agency.
  
At us youwill work with a team of engineers both during study phases as well as in implementation projects, in all aspects of systems engineering. You shall have a wide experience in several fields of systems engineering, such as requirements analysis, failure modes and effects analysis, engineering analysis, design trade-offs, systems modelling and spacecraft architectural design.
  
This work is to be performed together with a larger team of other system engineers, field experts and project managers. As a result, your work is dynamic, with other people, executed and reported in a very systematic and professional way so as to allow for the results and outcomes to be digested and used by the project-at-large and the end-customer.
  
Applicants are expected to have expertise/experience in several of the following areas:
  
Experience in numerical analytical methods applied in trade-offs, preliminary sizing and bounding of performance requirements
  
Experience using Python and/or MATLAB Simulink
  
Architectural principles for spacecraft mechanical and thermal design
  
Data handling systems, including both ground and in-flight software
  
Attitude and orbit control, orbital mechanics, and mission design
  
Be able to provide clear and coherent reporting and presentations in the English language
  
  

**Required qualifications:**  

As a minimum, Bachelor’s or Master’s Degree in related Engineering disciplines
  
At least 5 years of experience in systems engineering, either directly or indirectly through related work in other subsystems or industries
  
Fluent in the English language, both spoken and written
  
Located in, or willingness to relocate to, Stockholm, Sweden
  
  

**Added advantageous qualifications:**  

Experience using DOORS or other requirements management tools
  
Experience in RF, digital design and EMC are seen as additional advantage
  
Experience in one or more of a project’s life cycle starting from feasibility analysis (Phase A) through Preliminary Design (Phase B) and project implementation (Phases C/D/E).
  
  

We are looking for a team-player, learning quickly, providing technical advice to team members, as well as having the ability to work autonomously. Capability for problem solving and initiative are necessary as well as the ability to work in a pragmatic way focusing on finding the right level of quality and to deliver on time.
  
If you would be a part of our journey and involved in complicated defense projects, just apply!

title: Lead Level Artist on fantasy RPG
description:
Are you an artistic level artist with a good understanding of level design who can create visually impressive environments without compromising with the design functionality?


One of Swedens most renowned studios is looking for you, to help with their brand new fantasy RPG.

**Game Boost**
--------------

### **Enabling Smooth Game Productions!**

We provide AA/AAA people-friendly studios and publishers with stellar, remote, game developers in all crafts.

 *Also,feel free to check us out on* *LinkedIn**, or* *Facebook*

 **Mission brief:**


You will create final quality assets as well as function as a lead. You will coordinate the work between Level Designers & Environment Artists. Set out the modeling and texturing needs, coordinate tasks to modelers and textures responsible for the map; and follow up on the progress and quality of the work with the team leads & Art Director.


The work is a mix of 50/50 own art creation and lead work.

**Responsibilities:**

* Handle level design feedback and transition it to environment art
* Organize tasks for the environment art team
* Support our prop team with solutions for set dressing and composition
* Support Environment Art with solutions for mesh assembly and our fidelity approach
* Feedback and organize work for environment on daily basis
* Organize pipeline for quick feed-back and ironing out game tiles

**Details:**

* Start date: January 2025
* Duration: 6 months, possible extension
* Occupancy rate: 100% assignment (Full-time)
* Level: Senior
* Work set-up: remote or hybrid in Stockholm

 **Your player profile:**

* 7+ years as a level artist
* Experience working as a lead artist managing the work of other artists
* Experience with Unreal Engine
* Experience working on co-op games
* Comfortable with giving artistic direction, giving feedback, and handling conflict

 **Traits:**

  

We believe that being humble, collaborative, and open-minded will take you a long way and is the right way to go. It's a good foundation, even if we do understand that you possess a lot more personal attributes in addition.

 ***Note:***


We believe that the world of gaming *can* and *should* include everyone.

*Neither Game Boost, nor our clients tolerate toxic, intolerant behavior* ️

**How to Play!**


It's quick and simple since we aim for low manual data entry!


This means that you can use your LinkedIn or upload a profile of your liking.


Fill in a couple of choice questions that will help us get to know you, your skills, and also understand the basics, like when you're available, location, etc.


Yeah, that's it.


Buzz: Game Project, Assignment, Gig, Creator, Developer, Contractor, Freelancer, Self-employed, Consultant, Work-For-Hire, Co-Development, Programmer, Scripter, Software Engineer, Backend, Frontend, Fullstack, Unreal Developer, C++, UE4, UE5, Unity, Frostbite, Snowflake, Maya, Blender, Computer Games, Mobile Games, Careers in gaming, hitmarker, game jobs, remote game jobs, Google jobs

title: Radio Functional System Engineer
description:
**Grow with us**
----------------


**About this opportunity:**

  

Would you like to be part of the key product development area for Ericsson?


Do you like to turn ideas into concrete solutions?


We are looking for a colleague that would like to work with us in the development of new radio products in a creative environment!

  

You will belong to a small team with long experience in Radio products with an excellent collaboration and supportive attitude. We are responsible for functions in the radio that covers measurement, supervision and converting digital data into the RF domain and vice versa.  

Examples of technical areas are Control Algorithms, Passive Intermodulation Cancellation and Antenna Calibration. We collaborate with engineers, experts, and specialist both in the radio organization as in baseband and ASIC development. Currently we are developing radios for 5G and are involved in studies for 6G.

 **What you will do:**

* Drive the development of new radio functions and improve and adapt existing radio functions for new radio products.
* Contribute to technical studies.
* Contribute to meet future technical challenges and contribute to improvements.

 **The skills you bring:**

* You are interested in understanding how it all fits together to ensure an overall good solution.
* You are motivated to be part of the journey to bring an idea on paper into a final solution in the product.
* You are self-motivated with strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
* You have good communication skills and can express yourself both verbally and in written text.

  

Key Qualifications

* Education: M.Sc. or PhD in electrical engineering, embedded software, applied physics or equivalent.
* Domain experience: embedded systems and embedded software
* Min years of work experience: 7
* Min years of system work experience: 1
* Working experience in software development
**Why join Ericsson?**


At Ericsson, you´ll have an outstanding opportunity. The chance to use your skills and imagination to push the boundaries of what´s possible. To build solutions never seen before to some of the world’s toughest problems. You´ll be challenged, but you won’t be alone. You´ll be joining a team of diverse innovators, all driven to go beyond the status quo to craft what comes next.  

  

**What happens once you apply?**


Click Here to find all you need to know about what our typical hiring process looks like.


Encouraging a diverse and inclusive organization is core to our values at Ericsson, that's why we champion it in everything we do. We truly believe that by collaborating with people with different experiences we drive innovation, which is essential for our future growth. We encourage people from all backgrounds to apply and realize their full potential as part of our Ericsson team. Ericsson is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. learn more.

**Primary country and city:** Sweden (SE) || Stockholm

description:

**JAVA with AWS Cloud extensive experience, rate we can go a little higher side as well.** 




**Responsibilities:** 




 Design, develop, and maintain scalable web applications using Java, Spring Boot, and Angular.
 



 Implement and manage cloud-based solutions on AWS.
 



 Collaborate with cross-functional teams to define, design, and ship new features.
 



 Ensure the performance, quality, and responsiveness of applications.
 



 Identify and correct bottlenecks and fix bugs.
 



 Help maintain code quality, organization, and automation.
 



 Participate in code reviews and provide constructive feedback to peers.
 



 Stay up-to-date with emerging technologies and industry trends.
 



**Requirements:** 




 Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field.
 



 Proven experience as a Full Stack Engineer or similar role.
 



 Strong proficiency in Java and Spring Boot.
 



 Experience with front-end technologies such as Angular, HTML5, CSS3, and JavaScript.
 



 Hands-on experience with AWS services (EC2, S3, Lambda, RDS, etc.).
 



 Familiarity with RESTful APIs and microservices architecture.
 



 Knowledge of database systems like MySQL, PostgreSQL, or MongoDB.
 



 Excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail.
 



 Strong communication and teamwork abilities.
 



**Preferred Qualifications:** 




 Experience with CI/CD pipelines and DevOps practices.
 



 Knowledge of containerization technologies like Docker and Kubernetes.
 



 Familiarity with Agile/Scrum methodologies.
 



 Certification in AWS or related technologies.

title: Software Engineer (Typescript and Terraform) for Google Cloud Team
description:
**Job Description**
 Join us at H&M as a Software Engineer for the Google Cloud Engineering team. We craft cloud strategies to ensure H&M's infrastructure is user-friendly, secure, and cost-effective. Through self-service options and automation, we empower our product teams to kickstart their projects swiftly. We provide golden patterns, security measures, and cost optimization solutions at scale.
   

  

 Our goal is to equip product teams with the resources and knowledge to utilize the cloud effectively from day one. Additionally, we are committed to enhancing the developer experience and boosting engineering efficiency.
   

  

 At H&M, we are all about teamwork and fun. Join us in embracing creativity, delivering value, and making a difference together!
   

  

 As a Software Engineer on our team, you will design, develop, and maintain high-quality software solutions tailored to our organization's needs. Your primary focus will be on GCP Project Factory codes, enabling self-service project management and creating central services to enhance engineering efficiency.
   

  

 In this role, you will collaborate closely with team members to effectively leverage cloud services in an agile environment. By utilizing your expertise in modern architecture and software design patterns, you will empower product teams to develop scalable, maintainable, and innovative solutions for our customers. The ideal candidate has a strong background in software development, a passion for technology, and a drive for continuous learning and improvement.
   

  

**Key responsibilities:**
* Design, develop, and implement software solutions that align with project goals and meet quality standards.
* Write clean, efficient, and maintainable code using best practices and appropriate software design patterns.
* Perform unit testing, debugging, code reviews, and participating in Agile development activities.
* Develop the cloud landing zone and governance framework that serves as the foundation for all product teams.
* Develop central platform services with innovative solutions aimed at streamlining developer efficiency.
* Focus on enablement, automation and building self-service capabilities.
* Stay up to date with emerging technologies and industry trends to propose innovative solutions and improvements.


**Qualifications**
* Minimum 8 years of hands-on experience in application development.
* Strong proficiency in Terraform and experience working with CI/CD pipelines using GitHub Actions.
* Strong hands-on experience with TypeScript.
* Knowledge of Vue.js or similar frontend frameworks.
* Strong problem-solving skills and the ability to troubleshoot complex issues.
* Excellent communication and collaboration skills.
* Experience with Agile development methodologies like Scrum, Kanban, or SAFe.
* Experience with Google Cloud Platform (GCP) is nice to have.
* Understanding of security best practices in cloud environments.


**Additional Information**
 This is a
 **fulltime permanent position** 
 , starting as soon as possible according to agreement. The role is an on-site position, based in our office in Stockholm, Sweden.
   

  

 Apply by sending in your
 **CV in English** 
 as soon as possible, but no later than the
 **30th of November** 
 . Due to data policies, we only accept applications through career page.
   

  

**Benefits**
 We offer all our employees at H&M Group attractive benefits with extensive development opportunities around the globe. All our employees receive a staff discount card, usable on all our H&M Group brands in stores and online. Brands covered by the discount are H&M (Beauty and Move included), COS, Weekday, Monki, H&M HOME, & Other Stories, ARKET, Afound. In addition to our staff discount, all our employees are included in our H&M Incentive Program – HIP. You can read more about our H&M Incentive Program here.
   

  

 In addition to our global benefits, all our local markets offer different competitive perks and benefits. Please note that they may differ between employment type and countries.
   

  

**Inclusion & Diversity**
 H&M is a part of H&M Group. At H&M Group, we’re determined to create and maintain inclusive, diverse and equitable workplaces throughout our organisation. Our teams should consist of a variety of people that share and combine their knowledge, experience and ideas. Having a diverse workforce leads to a positive impact on how we address challenges, on what we perceive possible and on how we choose to relate to our colleagues and customers all over the world. Hence all diversity dimensions are taken into consideration in our recruitment process.
   

  

 We are committed to a recruitment process that is fair, equitable, and based on competency. We therefore kindly ask you to not attach a cover letter in your application.
   

  

**Company Description**
 H&M is a fashion brand that offers the latest styles and inspiration, from fashion pieces and unique designer collaborations to affordable wardrobe essentials. Our business idea is fashion & quality at the best price in a sustainable way. Learn more about H&M here.

title: Senior Java Software Engineer
description:
**This is Worldline** 




 Worldline helps businesses of all shapes and sizes to accelerate their growth journey - quickly, simply, and securely. We are the innovators at the heart of the payments technology industry, shaping how the world pays and gets paid. Our technology powers the growth of millions of businesses across 5 continents. And just as we help our customers accelerate their business, we are committed to helping our people accelerate their careers. Together, we shape the evolution.
 



  





**The Opportunity** 




 We are looking for a versatile Senior Software Engineer in Java for our Security team. In this position, you will be an active member of a highly-skilled Dev-Ops team, responsible for building, running, and maintaining security services across multiple software platforms within Worldline - Serving internal users, partners, and our valued customers.
 



  





**Day-to-Day Responsibilities​** 




 We are a DevOps team who proudly build, run and support our own products.
 


* Develop microservices based on Java technologies
* Contribute in technical design, code-reviews and build solutions to improve the customer centricity.
* Work with cross functional teams of Architects, Product managers and Engineers.
* Being active in our agile events like daily standups, planning, retros, demos, etc.
* Facilitating across teams and helping foster collaboration and open communication.
* Securing an outstanding qualitative service availability 24/7/365 where 3rd line on-call duty is expected according to a rotating schedule.



  





**Who Are We Looking For** 




 People who are passionate about developing and operating products and services that bring value to our customers, your team, and your business. You act as a role model to team members and others by staying committed, showing accountability, and delivering results. We always set our team delivery first! You also have:
 


* Proven experience in software development with high proficiency in Java.
* Experience in developing robust micro-services with high transaction intensity and availability.
* Experience in Identity and Access Management, Application and network security.
* Experience in working with Version control systems (Git), and CI/CD pipelines.
* Deep understanding of both on-premise and Cloud Infrastructure platforms - preferably GCP.
* Strong desire to learn new technologies and concepts.
* Bachelor’s or master’s degree in computer science, security, engineering, or other relevant fields.
* Deep understanding of software quality assurance principles.
* Full working proficiency in English.
* Are comfortable in a fast-paced environment, handling many different partners, prioritizing, and making quick decisions daily.
* Curious attitude, continuously learning and sharing your knowledge with your peers and others.



  





 To fully enjoy our autonomous and agile ways it would be great if you also have:
 


* Hands-on-experience in cloud computing, dockerization and kubernetes.
* Prior DevOps experience, including fostering the DevOps culture, automation, lean flow, measurement, and recovery.
* Knowledge in front-end development preferably in React.
* Experience in developing secure PCI-DSS certified solutions is considered an advantage.



  





**Perks & Benefits** 




 At Worldline, you’ll get the chance to be at the heart of the global payments technology industry and shape how the world pays and gets paid. On top of that, you will also:
 


* Health contribution
* Supplemental Health Insurance and Private Health Care
* Opportunity to hybrid working according to company standard
* Events and happenings at the office
* Convini Vending Machine, plus more.



  





**Shape the evolution** 




 We are pushing towards the next frontiers of payments technology, and we look for big thinkers to join our journey. People with passion, can-do attitude and a hunger to learn and grow. Here you’ll work with ambitious colleagues from around the world, take on unique challenges as a team, and make a real impact on the society. And with our empowering culture, strong technology and extensive training opportunities, we help you accelerate your career. Wherever you decide to go. Join our global team of over 18,000 innovators across 40+ countries, and shape a tomorrow that is yours to own.
 



  





**Learn more about life at Worldline at jobs.worldline.com** 




  





**We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity employer. We do not discriminate based upon race, religion, color, national origin, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, status as an individual with a disability, or any applicable legally protected characteristics.**
